programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Tracey's son Garth falls in love with Dorien's visiting niece Rosa, but things go wrong when a furious Dorien decides to meddle in their relationship

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: A distraught Mickey Webb sets his sights on vengeance, vowing to track down the mugger responsible for his mother's death, while Juliet Becker tries to trap a drug dealer. Honey Harman's fiance lands in a spot of bother when Eva Sharpe and Phil Hunter are called to the football club where he plays, forcing the kooky PC to decide where her loyalties lie

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gary Best has no choice but to arrest Gina Gold after a breathalyser test proves positive, leaving his belligerent boss facing serious trouble. Honey Harman also finds herself in a tricky situation - thanks to no-good boyfriend Fletch. Polly Page is shocked when Owen Preston's nephew turns up, wanting to know what happened to his uncle

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Debbie McAllister rescues Juliet Becker from the clutches of suspected rapist Gavin Raynor, leading to a passionate and emotional clinch, while Polly Page's confession leaves Cathy Bradford fuming. Kerry Young uses her feminine wiles on Dale Smith, only to scare the confused copper off with her new tough attitude

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gabriel Kent bullies Ruby Buxton into lying under oath, but Gina Gold's suspicions are aroused by their strange behaviour, while Polly Page becomes increasingly nervous as Samantha Nixon takes a closer look at the evidence found at the scene of Owen Preston's apparent suicide. Juliet Becker gives Debbie McAllister the brush-off, while passions run a little too high between Kerry Young and Dale Smith

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Des Taviner is left fuming after an audacious joyrider takes off in his patrol car - but he forces Kerry Young and Dale Smith to abandon their saucy shenanigans and help him catch the culprit before Gina Gold discovers his error. Ruby Buxton informs Gabriel Kent she's going to spill the beans about his recent behaviour, and Mickey Webb's obsession lands him in deep trouble when Jack Meadows returns home unexpectedly

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Julienne is drawn into a conflict between an estranged mother and daughter, both of whom are pregnant. Nurse Crane visits a photographic gallery in Soho with Sgt Woolf, but the trip does not go to plan, and Sister Frances' shyness causes concern. Trixie's keep fit class is chosen to host a special event, but her star pupil is devastated to learn that she is pregnant

programme.title: Dickensian
programme.desc: When a drunken prank goes dangerously wrong, Arthur realises the lengths to which Compeyson is willing to go to achieve his aims, while a potential rival at Satis House gives the trickster a cause for concern. Joseph Quinn and Tom Weston-Jones star in the star-studded period drama bringing together many of Charles Dickens' most popular characters

programme.title: Dickensian
programme.desc: Compeyson realises Matthew is in love with Amelia and manipulatively tells him that he must continue his travels in America in order to win her love, while Bucket continues his investigation by turning his sights on Mr Barbary, who was seen with Marley on Christmas Eve. Elsewhere, Bill tries to take Nancy away from her work as a prostitute, but fails to meet Fagin's lofty price demands, and Mrs Gamp tells Silas a hair-raising story to persuade him not to live alone. Period drama re-imagining the works of Charles Dickens, starring Stephen Rea, Adrian Rawlins and Joseph Quinn

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor's continuing campaign against bureaucrats finds another victim - a health and safety inspector who comes to check on the compost heap at the bottom of the Meldrews' allotment. Christmas special from 1991, with guest star Eric Idle

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Fifteen Streets
programme.desc: Feature-length drama based on Catherine Cookson's novel set in early 20th-century Newcastle. Worker John O'Brien lives near poverty in a small house in the workers district, yet falls in love with teacher Mary, daughter of a rich family. Despite the pressures exerted by the social difference, the vigorous Mary refuses to allow outer circumstances destroy their relationship. Starring Sean Bean and Clare Holman

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: Sister Boniface investigates a shocking murder at a groovy pirate radio station

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: Quirky crime drama. A housekeeper's assistant working for a celebrated crime writer becomes convinced she is losing her mind following a series of bizarre occurrences in his house. As master of illusion Jonathan and his intrepid sidekick Joey Ross puzzle over the strange events, they realise the mysterious death of a former resident in 1889, who apparently fell victim to the supernatural powers of his Egyptian employee, could hold the key. Starring Alan Davies, Sheridan Smith and guests Natalie Walter, Paul McGann, Sasha Behar and Ian McNeice

programme.title: Whitechapel
programme.desc: Part one of two. The team is fearful when Buchan is kidnapped. With Miles taunted by an unknown force in the station, Riley's infected hand worsening, and Mansell teetering on the edge of self-destruction, Chandler takes the lead in an investigation into the discovery of a runner's disembowelled body in the sewers. The incident has led some to suspect the return of the Black Swine - a mythical sow that was said to have spawned a litter of mutated feral creatures beneath Victorian London - and others to believe that a subterranean gang of cannibals is running wild. Crime drama, starring Rupert Penry-Jones, Phil Davis and Steve Pemberton

programme.title: Whitechapel
programme.desc: Part two of two. The hunt is on to find a gang of suspected cannibalistic killers lurking in the sewers before a missing girl becomes the next victim. The station is under attack and the forces of evil are moving against the team on all sides, and as the case takes a dangerously personal twist for Chandler, he must resort to desperate measures. Crime thriller, starring Rupert Penry-Jones, Phil Davis and Steve Pemberton

programme.title: Luther
programme.desc: When a series of monstrous and seemingly indiscriminate killings become ever more audacious and public, DCI John Luther and new recruit DS Catherine Halliday are confounded by a complex tangle of leads and misdirection that seems designed to protect an untouchable corruption. But, even as the case brings him closer than ever to the true face of evil, a reluctant Luther is forced to confront the unburied demons of his own recent past. Idris Elba stars, with Wunmi Mosaku and Patrick Malahide

programme.title: Broken
programme.desc: The arrival of Helen's brother Daniel immediately ruffles feathers when he gets into an argument with his sister's neighbour, Carl. Father Michael attempts to mediate, but when things escalate further, he's torn between doing what's right in the eyes of the law, and what he feels may resolve things between the two men without causing more upset to the grieving Helen. Elsewhere, Chloe Demichelis wants answers from the long suffering Michael. Drama, starring Sean Bean, Muna Otaru and Danny Sapani

programme.title: Great Expectations
programme.desc: Pip is devastated to learn the truth from Magwitch and rushes to Satis House, where he hears shocking news about Estella and discovers Miss Havisham has been encouraging his love for her adopted daughter out of cruelty. Wemmick warns him that rumours of Magwitch's return from Australia are rife, so he decides to help the convict evade recapture. Starring Douglas Booth, Ray Winstone, Vanessa Kirby and Gillian Anderson

programme.desc: Detective Inspector Henry Crabbe prepares for his retirement and the opening of his restaurant - but the police force seems reluctant to let him go. First episode of the crime drama, starring Richard Griffiths and Maggie Steed

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish dealer tries to beat Charlie Gimbert to a priceless collection of Jewish antiques that has turned up in Essex. Alfred Marks guest stars with Ian McShane

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Sahira announces she is leaving Holby, but Greg refuses to let her leave without telling her what she means to him. Eddi cannot wait to get away from Luc and AAU, but a power cut forces the pair to work together in a life-threatening situation. Meanwhile, Hanssen has to think on his feet when asked about future plans for the hospital

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A retired consultant has taken ill. After extensive test, Dr David Rowe suspects that she has bowel cancer

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: A bomb threat sends the team racing to a cinema, but as the search begins an explosion rips through the building _ and when the dust settles, it becomes clear not everyone got clear of the blast. Polly Page struggles to cope with being investigated, as Cathy Bradford continues to sabotage her unwary colleague's love life, and Ruby Buxton proves her worth during a tense confrontation at the hospital. Lisa Riley guest stars

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Paul and Janine see their plans begin to disintegrate

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: The Ferreiras' family wedding ends in chaos. Janine prepares for the ultimate sacrifice to keep Barry

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Beatrice and Evie try desperately to find financial backing for their business venture, but nobody is willing to invest in two inexperienced women. Stella Gonet stars

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Lady Jane persuades Lovejoy to act as driver for an old friend who has to attend her sea-faring brother's burial. The roguish antiques dealer is given the job of selling the late captain's Second World War medals, and there is a smart fashion photographer who wants them. However, some drunken sailors then come into the picture and Lovejoy finds himself dealing with the gun-toting Italian Angelo Pantaloni. Light-hearted drama, with Ian McShane

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: New recruit Alex tries to get to the bottom of a local policeman's aggressive behaviour and is disturbed to discover he has a drug habit, while Richard edges ever closer to finding out the truth about Kate's affair with Andrew. Elsewhere, Tom sets the cat among the pigeons when he is forced to break some bad news. Medical drama, starring Gary Mavers and Maggie O'Neill

programme.title: Waiting for God
programme.desc: A vicar suffers a nervous breakdown at a resident's funeral and Tom's son has trouble with his nymphomaniac wife. Comedy, starring Stephanie Cole and Graham Crowden

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc: Bob takes Terry on a tour of their old haunts - only to reveal most of them have been demolished. Terry finds it difficult accepting that times have changed during his time away - and a job interview proves the last straw. Classic comedy, with James Bolam and Rodney Bewes

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Lenny turns up in the village once more, followed by his long-suffering assistant Cliff. This time, the show-business hopeful becomes convinced that he can finally make a name for himself by becoming an escapologist. Guest starring Tommy Cannon and Bobby Ball

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Barry is shocked to discover his golf captain has moved in next door when Glenda shows a keen interest in her new neighbours. Hobbo tries to help a dejected Morton feel less lonely, while Hobbo's driving skills attract unwanted attention when he takes to the wheel of a truck following a visit to an inn

programme.title: The Last Detective
programme.desc: The murder of an Albanian refugee leads Davies to a dating agency, where he's shocked to learn his colleague Ray Aspinall is on the books and knew the victim well - along with several other dedicated admirers. Unable to pin the crime on agency boss Gavin Barnwell, Dangerous relies once more on Mod to provide the vital clue and nail the killer

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team reopens the 10-year-old murder of a librarian who also belonged to a witches' coven, and tries to track down the other members of the group. Halford has visions of his dead wife, and becomes convinced he has been cursed, while Lane starts to suspect the killing may have been part of a human sacrifice. With guest star Stephanie Beacham

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A police informant resurfaces after 17 years on the run, and claims to have details implicating a crook-turned-celebrity in an unsolved armed robbery. Sandra accompanies Strickland to the Hero of the Year Awards, where the recipient of the title is an old rival of Gerry's - who is brought in to work on the case. With guest star Steven Berkoff

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. When a wealthy banker is found dead at the bottom of her stairs, suspicion immediately falls on her media personality husband, who claims that she fell. Harry conducts the official post-mortem for the police, but finds himself on opposite sides of the case when Nikki performs a second one for the husband's solicitor - and comes up with very different results. Guest starring John Lynch

programme.desc: A vicar suffers a nervous breakdown at a resident's funeral and Tom's son has trouble with his nymphomaniac wife. Comedy, starring Stephanie Cole and Graham Crowden

programme.desc: The roguish antiques expert stumbles on what seems to be a bargain in Frankie's scrap yard in the shape of an iron cannon. programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Ash and Dan are involved in a bruising confrontation at the Ferreiras' wedding

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Barry reveals his feelings for Janine, while Shirley can't forgive Dan and Garry gives Lynne a birthday surprise

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The fashion house is officially opened, leaving Beatrice and Evie with the task of building up a clientele while facing tough competition from rival designers. Period drama, starring Stella Gonet and Louise Lombard

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A collector from Australia visits Britain to search for the one item he's coveted all his life - the legendary Benin Bronze. Unfortunately, the DTI won't allow an export licence, so he devises another way of getting hold of it. Drama, starring Ian McShane

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Andrew feels the wrath of health chief Richard Turner as news of his affair with Kate becomes common knowledge around Cardale _ and the Beeches staff find themselves caught in the crossfire. Things are particularly bad for Sam, whose efforts to support a rape victim are made doubly difficult, while Tom struggles to help a troubled teenager who is fighting a losing battle against anorexia. Popular drama, starring Gary Mavers, Maggie O'Neill and Joseph Millson

programme.title: Waiting for God
programme.desc: Tom's attempts to entertain his two obnoxious grandchildren prove a washout in more ways than one - so dauntless Diana decides to teach the two underage delinquents a lesson they'll never forget. Comedy, starring Stephanie Cole and Graham Crowden

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc: Terry decides he would like to track down some of his former girlfriends - little suspecting the shocks that await him. James Bolam stars

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Hobbo discovers the whereabouts of his real mother and decides to pay her a visit, but is unimpressed by the welcome he receives. Marina chains herself to a supermarket trolley in protest against the unreliability of men, while Nelly reveals some information that greatly lifts Hobbo's spirits

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Hobbo is convinced Nelly is his natural mother and tries to establish where he was born, while Howard vows to row across the Atlantic single-handed in a bid to counter Marina's suggestions that he lacks spontaneity. programme.title: New Tricks

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Following his recovery from a life-threatening head injury, Leo's first case involves the shattered body of a woman found at the bottom of a block of derelict flats. A post-mortem indicates suicide, but the investigation is reopened when the pathologist uncovers evidence that the victim was shot before being thrown off the roof, and his suspicions are aroused when DI Neill seems reluctant to pursue the possibility that the deceased was an informant for an undercover police officer

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Live coverage of the 14th and concluding day of the Grand Slam tournament from the All England Club, where the men's singles final takes centre stage. Novak Djokovic's recent dominance here continued last year when he defeated Nick Kyrgios 4-6, 6-3, 6-4, 7-6 to win his fourth consecutive title at SW19 and his seventh overall. He now sits top of the all-time men's list for singles Grand Slams won with 23 and few would have bet against him making it 24 when this tournament got under way

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Ham House in the London borough of Richmond-upon-Thames, where an 18th-century robe could be an important piece of Chinese history. Other items brought in include a portrait by Indian-born artist FN Souza, a collection of silver from the Gulf state of Oman, two goblets engraved with images of the Crystal Palace, a dressing gown made by from a blanket by a German prisoner of war, and a photo album that documents the moment British atomic bombs were tested in 1956

programme.title: World on Fire
programme.desc: Return of the drama following people from all walks of life during the Second World War, this time following events of 1940. As the Manchester Blitz gets underway, Robina's household has another visitor in the shape of Jan's sister Kasia. However, it soon becomes clear that the psychological scars of her experiences in Warsaw will not fade easily. Harry prepares to rejoin his unit as the fighting reaches north Africa. Starring Lesley Manville

programme.title: The Duchess (2008)
programme.desc: Fact-based period drama chronicling the life of Georgiana Spencer, who became Duchess of Devonshire in 1774 at the age of 17. Adored by the public for her extravagant lifestyle, Spencer endured a troubled marriage and was eventually driven into the arms of Charles Grey, a senior Whig politician. Starring Keira Knightley, Ralph Fiennes, Dominic Cooper and Charlotte Rampling

Joining him on the first edition is former Newcastle United striker Les Ferdinand, with the pair beginning by travelling from Bamburgh to Seahouses on e-bikes

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson is house hunting in Somerset with a couple who have a 675,000 budget to find a rural home that must have annexe potential for their parents

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Lee Burkhill are in the Hampshire town of Andover to transform a muddy plot into a practical garden. Owners Amy and Steve would like a relaxing space that suits their children and Tyson the dog

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts Natasha Raskin Sharp and Charles Hanson head to the North of England, on the opening salvo of an epic expedition together. Their transportation is the oldest car ever to grace the trip, a 1932 Riley Monaco. Charles unearths a 19th-century Japanese find, and some items from closer to home, but further back in time. Natasha relies on some obscure primary-school knowledge to decode one of her finds

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with co-host Konnie Huq

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Jermaine Jenas and Alex Jones present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kathy and Rocky's wedding doesn't go to plan as the events of the stag night and a surprise visit from Jo derails the day. Sharon tries to convince Keanu to come clean to Phil and Stacey finds out she drunkenly double-booked herself

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: In-depth current affairs report covering a story behind the headlines

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: The series pairing some of the UK's best artists with extraordinary subjects returns, with Bill Bailey hosting a run focusing on NHS workers. The first episode features sculptor Nick Elphick, whose work aims not just to replicate the human form, but to express a deeper meaning. His subject is trauma surgeon Martin, who treats two stabbings a day and two shootings a week, with most of his patients still children

programme.title: The Sixth Commandment
programme.desc: Fact-based crime drama exploring the story of retired teacher Peter Farquhar, and the fatal relationship that developed with a charismatic student. As a close bond develops between the two men, Peter finds himself suffering strange hallucinations and becomes uncertain of what has and hasn't happened. With anna Hardwicke, Anne Reid and Sheila Hancock

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: We Hunt Together
programme.desc: Freddy invites Baba back to her home to celebrate getting away with murder and, perhaps, introduce him to her first crush. Back in London, something's niggling Jackson. The body found hanged in the woods had a suicide message scrawled in the dirt beneath it, but where was the stick they must have used to write their last farewell? Lola and Jackson suspect that Freddy is working with a partner, but who?

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts this extended edition, with comedian Ria Lina and journalist Matt Chorley joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop as they delve into the news

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A family hike on Dartmoor sparks a helicopter rescue mission when a father of three is injured and a lorry terrifies a young girl and her horse when it speeds past them

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Ben Fogle and Kate Humble try to charm one of the park's most difficult but charismatic animals, Rio the cockatoo. Meanwhile, the keepers are alarmed to discover a large open wound under tiger Yuki's chin, and despite the high risk involved in sedating a tiger, they have no choice but to operate

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin and Tommy Walsh follow the progress of development projects on a flat in Faversham, a derelict commercial building in Walsall and a terraced house in Leeds

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Thomas Forrester and Ochuko Ojiri assist the red and blue teams as they shop for bargains in Detling, Kent. Later, at Catherine Southon Auctioneers, host Charlie Ross watches as a valuable collection of scent bottles fetches astonishing amounts

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick meets a family who make some of the best Gouda cheese in Britain, and uses their creations to make a tortilla dish with caramelised apples and onions. In the fishing village of Mevagissey, he discovers the origins of the sea shanty and the history of the pilchard fishing industry, when shoals of pilchards were so large they would attract killer whales

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: Robson is joined by fellow actor Mark Benton to explore the Cleveland and North Yorkshire coast while sampling outdoor activities that promise to be good for the mind and body. Their road trip takes in the world-famous cliff lift in the Victorian seaside resort of Saltburn-by-the-Sea, a night in a real-life Hobbit hole, drawing lesson in the fishing port of Staithes and a bracing cold water swim in the Tees

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a couple from London to find a new home in Surrey, and visits the British Wildlife Centre, where he learns about work to protect native species

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Lee Burkhill are in Cheltenham to create a contemporary exotic garden for Brandon, inspired by his journeys through the jungles of Asia and South America

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp and Charles Hanson explore the East Riding of Yorkshire, where Charles finds a few goodies on board a vintage double decker bus and learns all about the link between Dracula and the seaside town of Whitby. Meanwhile, keen ornithologist Natasha visits the coastal haven of Bempton Cliffs

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Konnie Huq

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Jermaine Jenas and Alex Jones present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Rocky panics as the wedding ceremony goes ahead and Lisa's lies unravel when Phil and Keanu speak to Louise. Theo does his best to wind up Martin and Stacey makes a decision about whether Martin will be in her future

programme.title: Why Sharks Attack
programme.desc: Following three shark attacks in two years just metres from a beach in the Red Sea vacation resort of Hurghada, Egypt, this documentary investigates the recent shift in shark behaviour and whether human activity and climate change could be the causes. Professor Gavin Naylor of the University of Florida looks back to the evolution of sharks for answers while Dr Dean Grubbs of Florida State University gets hands on, catching sharks to study and better understand their movements. Dr Laura Ryan, of Macquarie University, explains her research into a possible case of mistaken identity in which the sharks are mistaking humans for their preferred prey of seals.

programme.title: The Sixth Commandment
programme.desc: Peter is laid to rest and Ben delivers the eulogy at the funeral. He quickly begins a relationship with Peter's neighbour Ann, of which her niece is extremely suspicious

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Body on the Beach: What Happened to Annie?
programme.desc: Hazel Martin considers the theory that Annie Borjesson took her own life by drowning, exploring her family's suspicions that evidence was planted to make it look like suicide

programme.title: Body on the Beach: What Happened to Annie?
programme.desc: Hazel Martin accesses a fresh source of information that leads to a series of disturbing discoveries, shedding new light on what might have happened to Annie Borjesson. By approaching Swedish authorities, Hazel uncovers a huge amount of information from the investigation including bank statements, pathology reports, embassy correspondence and, crucially, witness statements from the time of the police investigation into Annie's death in 2005

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.desc: The ghosts have to bunk together while some rooms are renovated, but Thor's night terrors get worse, and the others try to get him professional help

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.desc: The secret about Trevor's missing pants is revealed when his wealthy former friend comes to Woodstone Mansion to buy the timepiece Sam and Jay found on Elias Woodstone's corpse

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley and Charlotte Smith are in Spalding, South Lincolnshire - the historic hub of Britain's bulb and flower farming industry, to explore its rich heritage. The pair discover how the the current generation of farmers are shaping the future of the flower industry and find out about the economic changes growers have faced. Charlotte meets James Lacey who explains how sunflowers are produced, picked and packed at his family farm and his love of high-tech harvesting. Joe joins young grower Hannah Benson as she delivers hand-cut blooms to sell at the UK's oldest flower auction. Tom Heap reveals how a study using flower chemicals in feed could reduce livestock methane emissions, and Adam Henson discovers how planting trees within arable fields can revolutionise a small farm's income

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Gardens
programme.desc: The horticultural tour continues with a trip to South Africa, one of the greenest zones in the world. In Cape Town, Monty Don visits the renowned Kirstenbosch Botanic Gardens, where he encounters the country's national plant, the king protea, and discovers an abundance of plant life in the Drakensberg mountains

programme.title: Landward
programme.desc: Dougie Vipond and the team are at Ingliston for the Royal Highland Show, with Cammy Wilson following all the action from the Golden Shears World Championship, which is being held at the event for the first time. Arlene Stuart meets members of the Highland Pony Society as they celebrate their centenary, and Dougie finds out about the farmers' initiative that's donating pick-up trucks to the Ukrainian front line

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Calum Clunie joins Diana Yates to help harvest the garlic she planted in November, and he also checks up on the hanging baskets he planted up a few weeks ago. George Anderson has the latest from his garden in Joppa and there is a visit to Nairn to find out more about a viewer's garden

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents more highlights from the series, offering viewers a chance to revisit some of their favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Live coverage of the opening play on day 14 of the Grand Slam tournament from the All England Club, featuring the concluding wheelchair finals

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Tom Kerridge is joined by fellow Michelin-starred chef Raymond Blanc to cook two dishes using ingredients that have fallen out of favour. Raymond recreates a favourite souffle from his childhood using semolina and heritage apples vying for favour against the host's old-fashioned mutton chops with cabbage and turnip gratin. Plus, Oliver Peyton reports on a distilling revival

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Katherine Jenkins meets creative Christians in Torbay, discovering the history of the ancient Torre Abbey and speaking to Martin Harris, leader of Christian drama company Unleashed

programme.title: Sweet Charity (1969)
programme.desc: A lonely but optimistic dancer in a seedy nightclub goes in search of true love, but finds instead a succession of deceitful men who only let her down. When she meets a shy, claustrophobic man in a lift, she thinks he might be the one - but tries to keep her past a secret. Musical, with Shirley MacLaine, John McMartin, Ricardo Montalban and Sammy Davis Jr, and featuring songs including The Rhythm of Life and Big Spender

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Couple Irene and Richard remodel their three-bedroom Croydon home, which has started to feel too small after living there for 19 years, with three teenagers fighting for space. Richard's biggest bugbear is being made to wait for hours to use the only bathroom in the house, while Irene is desperate for more space but is unwilling to get rid of her industrial sized tumble dryer, and architects Lizzie Fraher and Laura Jane Clark will have to incorporate a place for her prized possession into their design

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The five remaining sewers compete in the quarter-finals and are challenged to make garments inspired by history's most influential fashion icons. For the Pattern Challenge, judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young draw on old-time Hollywood glamour with a dress reminiscent of Audrey Hepburn's little black dress in Breakfast at Tiffany's. The Transformation challenge is inspired by Esme's work with fashion label Swanky Modes, specifically their range of garments made from shower curtains, and finally, in the Made to Measure, the sewers are asked to make smoking jackets

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Charlie Ross and Will Axon assess items at Ragley Hall in Warwickshire, including a Busby hat and a Worcester coffee set. Presenter Paul Martin explores the Battle of Edgehill

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Live coverage of the final play from the 14th and concluding day of the Grand Slam tournament. While the men's singles final was the main attraction of the day, a number of other events were set to take place, including the ladies' doubles and boys' singles finals and invitational doubles matches

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits a huge vacuum cleaner factory in the heart of Somerset, where over a million vacuums are made every year. Here, he follows the production of their biggest seller, the bright red Henry hoover. Elsewhere, Cherry Healey puts the contents of her vacuum bag under the microscope to see what is lurking in her home's dust

programme.title: Louis Theroux's Forbidden America
programme.desc: The film-maker returns to the US to explore the impact of the internet and social media on some of the most controversial corners of American society. He begins by meeting the new influencers of the far-right who are promoting an ideology that is defiantly racist, misogynistic, homophobic and anti-Semitic, often packaging the most extreme views as 'irony'. Louis attempts to understand their recent surge in popularity and challenges the divisive rhetoric that is being streamed to millions of young viewers online

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Qasa Alom presents a look back at highlights of the men's singles final, where the third Grand Slam title of the year was set to be decided. Plus, news from the rest of the day's finals as the famous tournament was brought to a conclusion, and a review of this year's staging of the event

programme.title: Golf: Scottish Open
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour presents action from the fourth and final day of the event at the Renaissance Club in North Berwick, which was won by America's Xander Schauffele last year

programme.title: When Eight Bells Toll (1971)
programme.desc: A Navy intelligence agent heads to Scotland, where he poses as a marine biologist to investigate the theft of millions of pounds in gold bullion from ships off the British coast. However, the locals counter his enquiries with hostility, especially when he sets his sights on a Greek tycoon, whom he suspects may be operating as a modern-day pirate. Thriller, with Anthony Hopkins, Robert Morley and Jack Hawkins. Based on a novel by Alistair MacLean

programme.title: The Richard Dimbleby Lecture with David Harewood
programme.desc: David Harewood delivers the 2023 Richard Dimbleby Lecture on the 75th anniversary of Empire Windrush arriving in the UK. He explores the challenges that were overcome by his parents' generation and considers their legacy through his own journey of self-identity, as well as how they have shaped and inspired a new generation. Introduced by Jonathan Dimbleby, from London's Battersea Arts Centre

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Chris Hull head to Marlborough to design and create a courtyard garden for Nancy and Simon. With a budget of just 4,000, the team try to make a space that reminds them of their old home in Beverly Hills

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Calum Clunie joins Diana Yates to help harvest the garlic she planted in November, and he also checks up on the hanging baskets he planted up a few weeks ago. George Anderson has the latest from his garden in Joppa and there is a visit to Nairn to find out more about a viewer's garden

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents the show from Shepton Mallet, Somerset, with the red and blue teams guided by experts John Cameron and Stephanie Connell. Away from the contest, Natasha tries her hand at making a famous local delicacy

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: Clive travels to the heart of Sicily to cook lunch in a community kitchen set up by Jamie Oliver's former restaurant manager and spends the night in a 700-year-old mansion. He also meets people from around the world who have bought homes in the one Euro house hub of Mussomeli and discovers arguably Italy's best street food in the island's capital Palermo

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels by tram to the former cotton town of Oldham on the edge of the Peak District. Here he visits Oldham Coliseum, the town's Victorian repertory theatre, and hears about the lifting of censorship by the Lord Chamberlain's Office in the late 1960s. He then goes hiking before a visit to Sheffield, where he attends a knife-making workshop. He ends this part of his journey admiring the striking post-war sculptures of Barbara Hepworth at the Yorkshire Sculpture Park near Wakefield

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys hosts the quiz, asking questions on the Levellers, Julie Andrews, Black Books and Isabella of Castile

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs Paul Walsh, Luke Selby and Ben Marks compete in the heats for the London and South East region, each preparing starters and fish courses. They are competing to cook at the final banquet, which takes place this year at Abbey Road Studios to mark 50 years since the Beatles played live together for the last time. Ben and Luke both present starters inspired by songs by the Fab Four, and Paul opts to use john dory for his Oasis-inspired dish for the fish course, titled 'What's the Story Morning Dory?'. Elsewhere, disaster strikes for Luke when problems with the tempura batter for his spiced mackerel dish threaten his chances in the competition

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: A molten glass specialist, an Icelandic abstract artist and a self-taught metal sculptor create artworks for lottery winners who want to celebrate the day their lives changed

programme.title: The Wonder of Animals
programme.desc: Wildlife documentary making use of scientific research into animal anatomy to explain how various species are uniquely built to thrive in specific habitats. Chris Packham begins by examine details the penguin, detailing how the aquatic, flightless bird's legs, wings and body shape have allowed it to conquer a wide range of landscapes, from deep forests and tropical waters to bustling cities and the toughest place on the planet - Antarctica

programme.title: Made in Great Britain
programme.desc: Steph McGovern tells the story of how the nation's craft and manufacturing skills have shaped its towns and cities and built modern Britain, taking four craftspeople on a journey around the country to discover what made the UK great. They begin by examining Sheffield's rapid transformation from a rural market town to an industrial powerhouse known as Steel City

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: James Lewis and Jonathan Pratt are in Glemham Hall, Suffolk, where they uncover a Victorian peddler doll complete with wicker basket, while Paul Martin explores Framlingham Castle

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Former winners Angela Barnes, Kemah Bob, Ade Edmondson and Beattie Edmondson test their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins a journey from the Midlands to the West Country, beginning in Derby, where he visits the city's famous 19th-century railway works. In Leicester he looks back to the early 1970s, when around 10,000 Asians arrived in the city after being expelled from Uganda by the dictator Idi Amin. He also hears how meat rationing during the Second World War led to the birth of Walkers crisps, still produced in the city

programme.title: The Secret Genius of Modern Life
programme.desc: Hannah Fry uncovers secrets behind the technologies of the modern world, beginning with the bank card. This humble piece of plastic is often taken for granted, but it's the digital key to accessing cash and is packed full of extraordinary technological innovations - including some with surprising and sinister origins. Hannah is granted access to Visa's European bank card data centre, discovers why we have Russian spies to thank for contactless payments, and finds out how the CIA and a 1950s housewife helped kick-start the bank card revolution

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell returns with the quiz based on patience and lateral thinking, with the Cribbagers taking on the Gunners in the opening heat. The teams try to draw together the connections between things that at first glance seem utterly random, with one set of clues asking what links horseshoe, pencil, walrus and handlebar

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: Amol Rajan takes over hosting duties from Jeremy Paxman as the academic quiz returns for its 30th series since the revival of the show in 1994. The opening match of the first round sees Trinity College, Cambridge taking on the University of Manchester

programme.title: Earth
programme.desc: Chris Packham presents this four-and-a-half-billion-year history of the planet, with each episode taking viewers on a journey through a pivotal moment when the Earth's future hung in the balance. The story begins with one of the darkest periods in the planet's history 252 million years ago - the worst mass extinction it has ever seen, when as much as 90 per cent of all species died

programme.title: The Two Ronnies Sketchbook
programme.desc: Messrs Corbett and Barker reminisce about some of the best moments from their career, including the classic Fork Handles sketch, and there's a final chance to catch up with the work of the Phantom Raspberry Blower. Katie Melua provides an interlude to the comic mayhem with a performance of Crawling Up a Hill. From April 2005

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: The World's War: Forgotten Soldiers of Empire
programme.desc: Part one of two. Historian and film-maker David Olusoga tells the story of First World War from the perspective of those of who made it a truly global conflict - the millions of African and Asian troops and ancillaries who served alongside Europeans. He begins by examining how the British and the French drew immediately on the military resources of their respective empires at the outbreak of the conflict, with Sikhs, Gurkhas, Garhwalis and Pathans from the Raj and Spahis, Zouaves and Senegalese from north and west Africa being among the first to experience the horrors of trench warfare

programme.title: Moon (2009)
programme.desc: Astronaut Sam Bell has been working alone at an energy-generating base on the moon for three years and desperately longs to return home. After he is injured in an accident, he begins to discover the disturbing truth about the operation he is running, and is forced to question his own identity. Sci-fi drama, starring Sam Rockwell, with the voice of Kevin Spacey

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley and Charlotte Smith are in Spalding, South Lincolnshire - the historic hub of Britain's bulb and flower farming industry, to explore its rich heritage. The pair discover how the the current generation of farmers are shaping the future of the flower industry and find out about the economic changes growers have faced. Charlotte meets James Lacey who explains how sunflowers are produced, picked and packed at his family farm and his love of high-tech harvesting. Joe joins young grower Hannah Benson as she delivers hand-cut blooms to sell at the UK's oldest flower auction. Tom Heap reveals how a study using flower chemicals in feed could reduce livestock methane emissions, and Adam Henson discovers how planting trees within arable fields can revolutionise a small farm's income

programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins a journey from the Midlands to the West Country, beginning in Derby, where he visits the city's famous 19th-century railway works. In Leicester he looks back to the early 1970s, when around 10,000 Asians arrived in the city after being expelled from Uganda by the dictator Idi Amin. He also hears how meat rationing during the Second World War led to the birth of Walkers crisps, still produced in the city

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents the show from the Herefordshire market town of Leominster and visits one of the oldest teddy bear factories in the UK. With Kate Bliss and Philip Serrell

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: Northern Ireland gymnast Rhys McClenaghan has won medals at all of the major international competitions. This documentary follows him as he takes part in 2022's three biggest events - the Commonwealth Games in Birmingham, the European Championships in Munich and the Gymnastics World Championships in Liverpool. In what was the toughest year of the 23-year-old's career so far, it offers an insight into his relentless training schedule and hears about the personal and physical sacrifices that come with being an elite athlete

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo joins the hunt for dark matter in the deepest mine in Britain in Boulby, North Yorkshire, then visits Middlesbrough's Transporter Bridge, which offers high views over the Tees estuary and the Cleveland Hills. At Saltholme, Michael joins the RSPB in a hide to observe a visiting bird of prey

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Tanya Arnold introduces action from the latest Super League matches, including St Helens v Catalans Dragons and Leeds Rhinos v Hull Kingston Rovers

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys invites more contestants to brave the black chair to answer question on the specialist subjects of Manchester United, the novels of Toni Morrison, Berthe Morisot, and William Tyndale, before each is tested on their general knowledge

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The London and South East chefs try to impress as they serve up their main courses and desserts. Ben Marks reveal a very personal reason for feeling connected to this years music theme as he served up Glass Onion, inspired by the Beatles song. Luke Selby is also thinking about the Fab Four with one of his dishes, The British Invasion, while Paul Walsh opts for Waterloo Sunset, a delicate fish and fregola dish inspired by the Kinks hit

programme.title: Planet Earth Live
programme.desc: Cameras follow elephant calf Maya and mother Zadie as they face numerous threats and challenges in Kenya's Samburu National Reserve. In order to survive, the two must reunite with their herd to have the best chance of avoiding predators and poachers. Julia Bradbury narrates

programme.title: Made in Great Britain
programme.desc: Steph McGovern pays a visit to York, where chocolate was transformed from a luxury drink for the rich into the nation's favourite treat. She meets up with Yorkshireman and chocolatier Paul A Young, who guides her through the history of the city's association with the food. Chocolate started as an expensive luxury drink, until the manufacture of a solid product became possible. Initially, hand-decorated chocolates with exotic flavours were sold to wealthy customers before, in the 1930s, chocolate became available for all as in the form of the Kit Kat bar

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: A compilation of valuations from the Ulster Folk and Transport Museum, Croombe in south Worcestershire, Crowcombe Court in Somerset and Bletchley Park

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Former winners Angela Barnes, Kemah Bob, Ade Edmondson and Beattie Edmondson test their general knowledge skills, while Richard Osman asks the questions

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's railway journey through the Midlands and West Country takes him to Coventry, where he recalls the destruction by the German Luftwaffe of the city's gothic cathedral in November 1940. He visits the factory of the London Electric Vehicle Company, manufacturers of the iconic London taxi, and then heads south to Royal Leamington Spa and the national centre for the Guide Dogs for the Blind

programme.title: The Secret Genius of Modern Life
programme.desc: Hannah Fry examines the tech behind food delivery apps like Just Eat, which are now used by 24 million people in the UK. She meets the R&D team behind food delivery titan Deliveroo, finds out how pensioners ordering Greggs revolutionised food delivery, and how pizza made many fall in love with the internet in the 1990s

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Architects Will Foster and Lizzie Fraher offer up some designs to help Reena and Wes create more space in their three-bedroom 1960s terrace house in Borehamwood, which they've outgrown since moving in 12 years ago. With Wes often working from home, daughter Nyla's toys are competing for space with the desk and the kitchen doesn't have space for a table, so they eat all their meal on their knees in the living room. With family in Barbados and in the UK, Reena and Wes are desperate to create some space to get everyone together

programme.title: Inside Dubai: Playground of the Rich
programme.desc: A look at what life is like for the millionaires and billionaires who live in the tax haven in the United Arab Emirates, as well as the people who serve them. The first edition features a woman whose wardrobe is worth 4 million, a man whose car number plate alone is worth 7 million, and a teenage billionaire who loves wrapping supercars

programme.title: Burnistoun
programme.desc: Highlights of the sketch show set in a fictional Scottish town, written by and starring Robert Florence and Iain Connell. Featuring siblings Paul and Walter, who run an ice-cream van, and the single-issue MP who is passionate about a roundabout

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: How to Win the Ashes
programme.desc: A look at what it takes to lift the most famous trophy in cricket, featuring stories from the most memorable clashes between England and Australia. Through interviews with cricket stars including Ben Stokes, Jimmy Anderson and Glenn McGrath, this documentary examines the on-field heroics that captured a nation's imagination, and lifts the lid on the behind-the-scenes turmoil, revealing a darker side to the pursuit of success

programme.title: Big Little Crimes
programme.desc: Two Police Community Support Officers find themselves caught in a web of lies designed to discredit their colleague, a tip-off leads to police cracking a 2million insurance scam and a married couple rip-off thousands of concert-goers with extortionate ticket prices

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Julia Somerville and Angela Rippon get to grips with the tricky problem of compostable and biodegradable packaging. Plus, the delivery companies letting down disabled customers

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A woman claiming 1.7 million for injuries who was caught on camera while shopping, and a yoga instructor who bent the truth to get a pay-out following an accident

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc: The impact that thefts and break-ins have on life in rural communities and how security systems that don't rely on a good internet connection are now helping to protect businesses in such areas. Presenter Rav Wilding also looks at how data captured by mobile phone masts helped bring a pair of prolific burglars to justice and how smart number plate recognition cameras can detect when a car is on false plates

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Vivaldi Unmasked
programme.desc: Conductor Charles Hazlewood explores the life of composer Antonio Vivaldi, examining the development of his music and his most famous work, The Four Seasons. Having mastered the violin and been hailed a child prodigy, the ordained priest and teacher went on to court scandal by embarking on a passionate affair with a much younger woman, and ended his life penniless and far from home

programme.title: Vivaldi's Four Seasons at the Proms
programme.desc: Violinist and conductor Pekka Kuusisto is joined by innovative folk musician Ale Carr to perform Antonio Vivaldi's Four Seasons as it's never been heard before, reimagining the timeless concertos as a magical world of folklore. In a concert led by Kuusisto's love for the natural world, Deutsche Kammerphilharmonie Bremen open the concert with the David Attenborough-inspired work, Birds of Paradise by Andrea Tarrodi, before Beethoven's First Symphony brings the first half to a rousing close. Presented by Katie Derham from the Royal Albert Hall

programme.title: Britain's Ancient Capital: Secrets of Orkney
programme.desc: Andy Torbet dives below the waves in search of the inspiration for the first stone circle, while Chris Packham and Neil Oliver spend the night on an abandoned island as they hunt for clues as to why cultures change. Meanwhile, Shini Somara tests the technology behind a bronze age sauna and the archaeologists uncover a remarkable find

programme.title: Vienna: Empire, Dynasty and Dream
programme.desc: Simon Sebag Montefiore follows the Habsburgs to their dramatic demise. From his struggles with Napoleon III and Bismarck and the suicide of his son Rudolf, to the assassination of his beautiful wife Sisi, Emperor Franz Josef's empire and his family proved impossible to control - but while the Habsburgs headed for extinction, Vienna blossomed

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: A celebration of the British seaside holiday experience, from its Victorian origins and heyday in the 1950s, through its slow decline and attempts at modern-day reinvention

programme.title: Parkinson: The Interviews
programme.desc: Highlights of the raconteur's appearances on the chat show, providing a fascinating insight into Ustinov's prolific career as writer, director, actor and ambassador for Unicef, and revealing his passion, intelligence and ability to entertain

programme.title: Vivaldi Unmasked
programme.desc: Conductor Charles Hazlewood explores the life of composer Antonio Vivaldi, examining the development of his music and his most famous work, The Four Seasons. Having mastered the violin and been hailed a child prodigy, the ordained priest and teacher went on to court scandal by embarking on a passionate affair with a much younger woman, and ended his life penniless and far from home

programme.title: Vienna: Empire, Dynasty and Dream
programme.desc: Simon Sebag Montefiore follows the Habsburgs to their dramatic demise. From his struggles with Napoleon III and Bismarck and the suicide of his son Rudolf, to the assassination of his beautiful wife Sisi, Emperor Franz Josef's empire and his family proved impossible to control - but while the Habsburgs headed for extinction, Vienna blossomed

programme.title: Yorkshire Walks
programme.desc: Artist Shanaz Gulzar seeks inspiration as she explores Wensleydale, setting out from Leyburn on a walk to Bolton Castle, where Mary, Queen of Scots was imprisoned in 1568. Along the way, Shanaz discovers evidence of an industrial past and talks to a volunteer worker on the heritage railway line, while also stopping to sketch and reflect

programme.title: Secrets of Bones
programme.desc: Evolutionary biologist Ben Garrod explores how having a skeleton has helped vertebrates to colonise and dominate almost every habitat on Earth. He begins his journey by looking at the influence of bones on size, revealing how they are capable of supporting large animals, with the strongest bone able to withstand 109 tons of pressure

programme.title: How to Build a Dinosaur
programme.desc: Dr Alice Roberts discovers how to put a dinosaur skeleton back together, complete with muscles, correct posture and, in some cases, the correct skin colour. The creatures died out 65 million years ago and full skeletons are rarely found

programme.title: Dinosaurs, Myths and Monsters
programme.desc: Tom Holland charts how mankind's interpretation of prehistoric remains has changed over the centuries, exploring ancient stories developed to explain the discoveries of bones and fossils. He also reveals why some of these myths went on to influence the work of modern paleontologists, and learns how traditional Native American stories led to one of the most important archaeological finds of the 19th century

programme.title: Dinosaurs: The Final Day with David Attenborough
programme.desc: Palaeontologist Robert DePalma has made an incredible discovery in a prehistoric graveyard - fossilised creatures, astonishingly well preserved, that could help change man's understanding of the last days of the dinosaurs. Evidence from his site records the day when an asteroid bigger than Mount Everest struck the planet causing the dinosaurs' extinction. In light of these findings, the veteran naturalist reveals exactly what happened, employing CGI to recreate the late Cretaceous period from which he documents, minute-by-minute, the events of that cataclysmic day some 66 million years ago

programme.title: The Big Think
programme.desc: Nobel Laureate Sir Paul Nurse examines the moral issues behind extending human life, as methods such as gene editing and stem cell therapies transform the way medicine can conquer disease today. These extreme frontiers of medicine also come with a range of ethical dilemmas, such as when the right time is to try out an experimental technique on a patient and should cells from aborted foetuses be used for medical treatments

programme.title: Yorkshire Walks
programme.desc: Artist Shanaz Gulzar seeks inspiration as she explores Wensleydale, setting out from Leyburn on a walk to Bolton Castle, where Mary, Queen of Scots was imprisoned in 1568. Along the way, Shanaz discovers evidence of an industrial past and talks to a volunteer worker on the heritage railway line, while also stopping to sketch and reflect

In light of these findings, the veteran naturalist reveals exactly what happened, employing CGI to recreate the late Cretaceous period from which he documents, minute-by-minute, the events of that cataclysmic day some 66 million years ago

programme.title: Yorkshire Walks
programme.desc: Artist Shanaz Gulzar goes on a ramble that straddles the north and south sides of Calderdale, stopping along the way to sketch and read poetry. She begins in the village of Heptonstall, rambles past Hell Hole and along the canal in Hebden Bridge, before climbing to the Stoodley Pike peace monument

programme.title: Secrets of Bones
programme.desc: Evolutionary biologist Ben Garrod explores how skeletons have adapted to allow vertebrates to move on land in different ways, such as swinging through trees, sliding along forest floors, and running across plains at speed. He looks at the spines of both cheetahs and snakes, and uncovers the role of the pentadactyl limb

programme.title: Hancock's Half Hour
programme.desc: Tony buys a new home from estate agent Sid - only to discover it backs onto an airfield. Vintage comedy, starring Tony Hancock and Sid James

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc: On the eve of his wedding, Bob turns down the chance of going on a drunken rampage in favour of a quiet night in. Classic comedy, starring Rodney Bewes and James Bolam

programme.title: Frankie Howerd: Rather You Than Me
programme.desc: Drama in which David Walliams portrays one of his heroes, Frankie Howerd. The comedian and actor achieved great success in his career but suffered from stage fright, bouts of depression and inner conflict about his homosexuality, which was not disclosed until his death in 1992. Rafe Spall plays Howerd's long-time partner Dennis Heymer. First broadcast in 2008

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: Documentary first shown in 1990 looking at the life of the comedian and actor, featuring highlights from his TV and film career. Contributors include Max Bygraves, Ned Sherrin, Johnny Speight, Eric Sykes, June Whitfield and Michael Winner

programme.title: Origins of Us
programme.desc: Anatomist Alice Roberts charts how the hunt for food down the ages has affected the way people look and behave today. A lion kill reveals how similar today's diet is to that of 1.7 million years ago and the origin of marriage is traced back to the Hadza tribe of Tanzania, hunter-gatherers who have been forming long-term couples for 10,000 years. Plus, a skateboarding experiment proves men cannot help showing off to attract the opposite sex

programme.title: Caribbean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon begins the last leg of his journey in Nicaragua and visits the Rama-Kriol people, who face losing their ancestral homes due to the construction of a new transoceanic waterway. Simon then discovers Hondurans living in the grip of some of the most violent criminal gangs in the world, with San Pedro Sula having the highest murder rate of any city on the planet. His journey ends in Jamaica, where he spends time with young people who have rejected gang life, offering a model of hope for future generations

programme.desc: When a strange, lumpy, green ball rolls to their feet, Fred and Pete are sure they've found treasure. But what is it? At the Museum of Cornish Treasures, Archie tells them that their treasure grew up in Cornwall under a big dome, and Suzy sends them to the Eden Project to find out more. Here, they meet Catherine who says their treasure is a type of fruit from a place far away. But how did the fruit get to Cornwall? Suzy buzzes on the Treasure Comm and suggests Fred and Pete take a trip on a zip wire and explore the tropical dome. They meet Catherine again who reveals their treasure is a screw pine fruit. This fruit is usually found in hot countries in Asia and Africa but is able to grow in Edens dome because it's so warm inside. Catherine takes Fred and Pete on a plant hunt around the tropical dome. Catherine explains how fruits produce seeds which then grow into new trees that produce fruits themselves

programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Ham House in the London borough of Richmond-upon-Thames, where an 18th-century robe could be an important piece of Chinese history. Other items brought in include a portrait by Indian-born artist FN Souza, a collection of silver from the Gulf state of Oman, two goblets engraved with images of the Crystal Palace, a dressing gown made by from a blanket by a German prisoner of war, and a photo album that documents the moment British atomic bombs were tested in 1956

However, it soon becomes clear that the psychological scars of her experiences in Warsaw will not fade easily. Harry prepares to rejoin his unit as the fighting reaches north Africa. Starring Lesley Manville

programme.title: The Duchess (2008)
programme.desc: Fact-based period drama chronicling the life of Georgiana Spencer, who became Duchess of Devonshire in 1774 at the age of 17. Adored by the public for her extravagant lifestyle, Spencer endured a troubled marriage and was eventually driven into the arms of Charles Grey, a senior Whig politician. Starring Keira Knightley, Ralph Fiennes, Dominic Cooper and Charlotte Rampling

Natasha relies on some obscure primary-school knowledge to decode one of her finds

Dr Erin Lloyd Jones visit the ruins of the ancient abbey at Strata Florida and Jonny Cotsen meets military veterans who have taken up art

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: The series pairing some of the UK's best artists with extraordinary subjects returns, with Bill Bailey hosting a run focusing on NHS workers. The first episode features sculptor Nick Elphick, whose work aims not just to replicate the human form, but to express a deeper meaning. His subject is trauma surgeon Martin, who treats two stabbings a day and two shootings a week, with most of his patients still children

programme.title: Why Sharks Attack
programme.desc: Following three shark attacks in two years just metres from a beach in the Red Sea vacation resort of Hurghada, Egypt, this documentary investigates the recent shift in shark behaviour and whether human activity and climate change could be the causes. Professor Gavin Naylor of the University of Florida looks back to the evolution of sharks for answers while Dr Dean Grubbs of Florida State University gets hands on, catching sharks to study and better understand their movements. Dr Laura Ryan, of Macquarie University, explains her research into a possible case of mistaken identity in which the sharks are mistaking humans for their preferred prey of seals.

programme.desc: Joe Crowley and Sammi Kinghorn are in the Lake District finding out how cycling is still one of the top outdoor pursuits in the UK, and how electric bikes are opening up the countryside like never before. Adam Henson talks to farmers taking part in a sheep shearing competition, and Tom Heap explores the impact of banning snares

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Ham House in the London borough of Richmond-upon-Thames, where an 18th-century robe could be an important piece of Chinese history. Other items brought in include a portrait by Indian-born artist FN Souza, a collection of silver from the Gulf state of Oman, two goblets engraved with images of the Crystal Palace, a dressing gown made by from a blanket by a German prisoner of war, and a photo album that documents the moment British atomic bombs were tested in 1956

programme.title: World on Fire
programme.desc: Return of the drama following people from all walks of life during the Second World War, this time following events of 1940. As the Manchester Blitz gets underway, Robina's household has another visitor in the shape of Jan's sister Kasia. However, it soon becomes clear that the psychological scars of her experiences in Warsaw will not fade easily. Harry prepares to rejoin his unit as the fighting reaches north Africa. Starring Lesley Manville

programme.title: The Duchess (2008)
programme.desc: Fact-based period drama chronicling the life of Georgiana Spencer, who became Duchess of Devonshire in 1774 at the age of 17. Adored by the public for her extravagant lifestyle, Spencer endured a troubled marriage and was eventually driven into the arms of Charles Grey, a senior Whig politician. Starring Keira Knightley, Ralph Fiennes, Dominic Cooper and Charlotte Rampling

programme.desc: A base jump goes terrifyingly wrong when a parachute opens the wrong way, and a freak lightning strike sets fire to an annexe with a young girl inside. Plus, a terrifying road rage incident threatens the life of a cyclist and a pedestrian. Presented by Nick Knowles

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Ben Fogle and Kate Humble return to Longleat House to follow the lives of the exotic animals at its safari park, beginning by looking at the impact of the pandemic

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A Victorian house in Strood in Kent whose only toilet was outside, a semi-detached house in Leeds and a damp top floor flat in Kilmarnock are all sold at auction. As Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell reveal, all three developers encounter unexpected issues as they work to breathe new life into their recently acquired bricks and mortar

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents the show from the Herefordshire market town of Leominster and visits one of the oldest teddy bear factories in the UK. With Kate Bliss and Philip Serrell

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef reveals the Cornwall that he knows and loves, championing the food, history, music, art and culture of the county,. He begins at his family home in Trevose Head on the north coast, where as a child he would go fishing with his father

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: The actor explores the north-east of England in the company of family and famous friends, showcasing the region's natural beauty and the important role it plays in relieving stress and supporting mental health. Joining him on the first edition is former Newcastle United striker Les Ferdinand, with the pair beginning by travelling from Bamburgh to Seahouses on e-bikes

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson is house hunting in Somerset with a couple who have a 675,000 budget to find a rural home that must have annexe potential for their parents

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Lee Burkhill are in the Hampshire town of Andover to transform a muddy plot into a practical garden. Owners Amy and Steve would like a relaxing space that suits their children and Tyson the dog

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts Natasha Raskin Sharp and Charles Hanson head to the North of England, on the opening salvo of an epic expedition together. Their transportation is the oldest car ever to grace the trip, a 1932 Riley Monaco. Charles unearths a 19th-century Japanese find, and some items from closer to home, but further back in time. Natasha relies on some obscure primary-school knowledge to decode one of her finds

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Jermaine Jenas and Alex Jones present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kathy and Rocky's wedding doesn't go to plan as the events of the stag night and a surprise visit from Jo derails the day. Sharon tries to convince Keanu to come clean to Phil and Stacey finds out she drunkenly double-booked herself

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: In-depth current affairs report covering a story behind the headlines

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: The series pairing some of the UK's best artists with extraordinary subjects returns, with Bill Bailey hosting a run focusing on NHS workers. The first episode features sculptor Nick Elphick, whose work aims not just to replicate the human form, but to express a deeper meaning. His subject is trauma surgeon Martin, who treats two stabbings a day and two shootings a week, with most of his patients still children

programme.title: The Sixth Commandment
programme.desc: Fact-based crime drama exploring the story of retired teacher Peter Farquhar, and the fatal relationship that developed with a charismatic student. As a close bond develops between the two men, Peter finds himself suffering strange hallucinations and becomes uncertain of what has and hasn't happened. With anna Hardwicke, Anne Reid and Sheila Hancock

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: We Hunt Together
programme.desc: Freddy invites Baba back to her home to celebrate getting away with murder and, perhaps, introduce him to her first crush. Back in London, something's niggling Jackson. The body found hanged in the woods had a suicide message scrawled in the dirt beneath it, but where was the stick they must have used to write their last farewell? Lola and Jackson suspect that Freddy is working with a partner, but who?

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts this extended edition, with comedian Ria Lina and journalist Matt Chorley joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop as they delve into the news
