programme.desc: A family hike on Dartmoor sparks a helicopter rescue mission when a father of three is injured and a lorry terrifies a young girl and her horse when it speeds past them

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Ben Fogle and Kate Humble try to charm one of the park's most difficult but charismatic animals, Rio the cockatoo. Meanwhile, the keepers are alarmed to discover a large open wound under tiger Yuki's chin, and despite the high risk involved in sedating a tiger, they have no choice but to operate

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin and Tommy Walsh follow the progress of development projects on a flat in Faversham, a derelict commercial building in Walsall and a terraced house in Leeds

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Thomas Forrester and Ochuko Ojiri assist the red and blue teams as they shop for bargains in Detling, Kent. Later, at Catherine Southon Auctioneers, host Charlie Ross watches as a valuable collection of scent bottles fetches astonishing amounts

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick meets a family who make some of the best Gouda cheese in Britain, and uses their creations to make a tortilla dish with caramelised apples and onions. In the fishing village of Mevagissey, he discovers the origins of the sea shanty and the history of the pilchard fishing industry, when shoals of pilchards were so large they would attract killer whales

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: Robson is joined by fellow actor Mark Benton to explore the Cleveland and North Yorkshire coast while sampling outdoor activities that promise to be good for the mind and body. Their road trip takes in the world-famous cliff lift in the Victorian seaside resort of Saltburn-by-the-Sea, a night in a real-life Hobbit hole, drawing lesson in the fishing port of Staithes and a bracing cold water swim in the Tees

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a couple from London to find a new home in Surrey, and visits the British Wildlife Centre, where he learns about work to protect native species

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Lee Burkhill are in Cheltenham to create a contemporary exotic garden for Brandon, inspired by his journeys through the jungles of Asia and South America

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp and Charles Hanson explore the East Riding of Yorkshire, where Charles finds a few goodies on board a vintage double decker bus and learns all about the link between Dracula and the seaside town of Whitby. Meanwhile, keen ornithologist Natasha visits the coastal haven of Bempton Cliffs

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Konnie Huq

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: River City
programme.desc: A frustrated Lenny confesses his feelings of inadequacy to Mulvaney, who offers his support in getting justice for Lydia. Meanwhile, tensions mount between Roisin and Tommy over an offer from Andrew to save Tommy's business, and Dean and Madonna share a spark of romance

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Rocky panics as the wedding ceremony goes ahead and Lisa's lies unravel when Phil and Keanu speak to Louise. Theo does his best to wind up Martin and Stacey makes a decision about whether Martin will be in her future

programme.title: Why Sharks Attack
programme.desc: Following three shark attacks in two years just metres from a beach in the Red Sea vacation resort of Hurghada, Egypt, this documentary investigates the recent shift in shark behaviour and whether human activity and climate change could be the causes. Professor Gavin Naylor of the University of Florida looks back to the evolution of sharks for answers while Dr Dean Grubbs of Florida State University gets hands on, catching sharks to study and better understand their movements. Dr Laura Ryan, of Macquarie University, explains her research into a possible case of mistaken identity in which the sharks are mistaking humans for their preferred prey of seals.

programme.title: The Sixth Commandment
programme.desc: Peter is laid to rest and Ben delivers the eulogy at the funeral. He quickly begins a relationship with Peter's neighbour Ann, of which her niece is extremely suspicious

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Body on the Beach: What Happened to Annie?
programme.desc: Hazel Martin considers the theory that Annie Borjesson took her own life by drowning, exploring her family's suspicions that evidence was planted to make it look like suicide

programme.title: Body on the Beach: What Happened to Annie?
programme.desc: Hazel Martin accesses a fresh source of information that leads to a series of disturbing discoveries, shedding new light on what might have happened to Annie Borjesson. By approaching Swedish authorities, Hazel uncovers a huge amount of information from the investigation including bank statements, pathology reports, embassy correspondence and, crucially, witness statements from the time of the police investigation into Annie's death in 2005

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.desc: The ghosts have to bunk together while some rooms are renovated, but Thor's night terrors get worse, and the others try to get him professional help

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.desc: The secret about Trevor's missing pants is revealed when his wealthy former friend comes to Woodstone Mansion to buy the timepiece Sam and Jay found on Elias Woodstone's corpse

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Live coverage of the 14th and concluding day of the Grand Slam tournament from the All England Club, where the men's singles final takes centre stage. Novak Djokovic's recent dominance here continued last year when he defeated Nick Kyrgios 4-6, 6-3, 6-4, 7-6 to win his fourth consecutive title at SW19 and his seventh overall. He now sits top of the all-time men's list for singles Grand Slams won with 23 and few would have bet against him making it 24 when this tournament got under way

programme.title: Reporting the French Riots
programme.desc: Katie Razzall looks at the challenges of reporting the French riots with Katya Adler, Europe Editor, BBC News; Phil Chetwynd, Global News Director, Agence France-Presse and Emma Pearson, Editor, The Local France. Also in the programme, the Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich has spent 100 days behind bars in Russia. The US, the Wall Street Journal and Mr Gershkovich all deny the allegation by the Russian authorities that he is a spy. programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd tries to compete with Berry and prove that he's 'more caring' by rescuing flies whether they want or need rescuing or not - however, his zealousness backfires when he attempts a daring rescue 'outside'!

programme.title: Looney Tunes Cartoons
programme.desc: Classic cartoon capers

programme.title: Looney Tunes Cartoons
programme.desc: Classic cartoon capers

programme.title: Mystery Lane
programme.desc: Animated series about a young guinea pig and her little brother, who look to solve police investigations. A cat named Jellybean comes to consult Clever: her master, a great violinist, lost his mind and broke his violin in a tantrum, as if he'd suddenly become a baby.

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. On her last test, Sam got an B+ instead of an A++, which lowers her grade average to a mere A. She loses sleep over this, has nightmares, and even forgets to perform her beloved Hammy's evening ritual - when Sam realises what a dreadful state she's in, her mind is made up to ask the Spectral Sceptre for the power to enter computers to alter her grade average in Mr Brick's computer. At half-power, Sam behaves like a computer virus - and infects her teacher's computer...

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Brick wants a volunteer for a 'Nap Experiment' at school, a protocol which he hopes can improve his students' learning capacities. Mo volunteers, along with loads of other kids. Faced with so many volunteers, Brick proposes to choose the candidate via a lucky draw. Mo desperately wants to be chosen. He decides to favour his chances by asking the Scepter for the power of luck. But the half power means that he and Sam alternate between good luck... and bad luck.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo and Guess Who?
programme.desc: When the gang helps Carol Burnett beta test her brand new virtual reality Movieland world, they find that the only thing more exciting than being inside some of the most famous movies of all time is being chased by a monster through some of the most famous movies of all time. Can they unravel the mystery of what's gone wrong with Carol's Movieland? Or will the virtual reality unravel our heroes and leave them stranded in there for ever

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Katie Piper's Breakfast Show
programme.desc: TV presenter Lisa Snowdon joins Katie on the show, and there's also expert advice from social media commentator Drew Benvie

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan is joined at Manor Farm by actress Joanna Page, who discusses celebrating the nation's pets, while Countryfile presenter Matt Baker talks about life on the farm. Plus, carpenter Wayne Perrey has a step-by-step guide to making window boxes

programme.title: Cooking with the Stars
programme.desc: Chris Eubank, Jason Watkins, Claire Richards and Indiyah Polack take to the kitchen in a series of head to head cooking battles. This time, they each attempt to create the perfect Indian dish, and avoid elimination in the Cook Off. Presented by Emma Willis and Tom Allen

programme.title: The Masked Singer US
programme.desc: The final two singers perform two songs each and both are unmasked, before one of them is awarded the Golden Mask Trophy

programme.title: Goodwood Festival of Speed
programme.desc: Coverage of the motoring event in West Sussex, which plays host to a vast array of historic racing cars and offers spectators the chance to see new vehicles

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a comical selection of mishaps filmed by viewers, featuring everything from giddy grandmas, cute kids and crazy animals to below-the-belt mishaps, practical jokers and painful-looking accidents

programme.title: Octopussy (1983)
programme.desc: James Bond investigates the mysterious death of a British agent in East Berlin, a mission that leads him to a glamorous, international jewel thief. He discovers one of her criminal cohorts, an Indian gangster, is in league with a crazed Soviet general who plans to heat up the Cold War by detonating a nuclear bomb in an American Air Force base. Spy adventure, with Roger Moore, Maud Adams, Steven Berkoff and Louis Jourdan

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts as Christopher Biggins, Rosemary Shrager and Gareth Chilcott answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the better their chances of collecting the 20,000 prize for their selected charity

programme.title: A Year on Planet Earth
programme.desc: Stephen Fry examines the impact that Spring has upon the natural world, a season which sees new life erupting across the Northern hemisphere as temperatures begin to rise. Further south in Kenya, a cheetah mother struggles to bring up her young in the wet season, and in Trinidad, turtle hatchlings begin their instinctive march towards the sea

programme.title: A Spy Among Friends
programme.desc: Desperate for answers, MI5 investigator Lily Thomas tries to get Elliott to reveal what he knows about Philby, using psychological tricks to steer him in the right direction. Later, Philby reveals to Sergei why he is a communist and lethal double agent. Starring Damien Lewis, Guy Pearce and Anna Maxwell Martin

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Spice Trail Adventure
programme.desc: Joanna returns to her birthplace, India, in search of a kitchen cupboard staple once known as 'black gold'. Starting in the majestic ancient city of Hampi, she's invited to a dazzling Hindu festival by a local rock climber. Then it's onwards to the lush backwaters of Kerala, where she meets a great grandmother who teaches the oldest martial art in the world and spends the night in a magical houseboat inspired by the old spice traders

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell meet Sara Hathaway who, after losing her adoptive mother and older brother in the space of just a year, is desperate to find her birth family. Plus, Diane Kerridge shares her story of being forced to give up the child she gave birth to as a teenager in the 1960s. Over 50 years later, she is hoping to find her long lost son

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from stage 15, which consisted of a 179km course from Les Gets Les Portes du Soleil to Saint-Gervais Mont-Blanc. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Peter Kennaugh and Ellen van Dijk, reports by Daniel Friebe and Matthew Rendell, and commentary from Ned Boulting and David Millar

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show, asking three contestants to 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win 50,000

programme.title: The Masked Singer US
programme.desc: The final two singers perform two songs each and both are unmasked, before one of them is awarded the Golden Mask Trophy

programme.title: Motorsport UK
programme.desc: Richard John Neil presents from Snetterton, with racing action from the Mini Challenge and the British F4 Championship

programme.title: Unwind with ITV

programme.title: Made in Britain
programme.desc: A look at a married couple that have made a booming business out of their hand-made Scotch eggs, and how a cotton mill-turned-soap factory is producing traditional bars, according to a process passed down through the generations. Plus, the team of craftsmen making the most accurate compasses in the world, and a behind-the-scenes look at the family firm making teddy bears that are cherished by children around the world

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: Lorraine

programme.title: This Morning

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Celebrity interviews and studio discussion from a female perspective

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The chef ends his excursion at the Bois de Boulogne, a park on the outskirts of Paris, coinciding with the hosting of a prestigious steeplechase event at its Auteuil Hippodrome. James meets fellow Yorkshireman and jockey James Revelly and rustles up leeks vinaigrette with salmon and lamb cutlets with a colourful ratatouille. Later, the chef pays a visit to the Michelin-starred Pre Catelan restaurant, where he enjoys his favourite meal of the trip

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Adil Ray in which couples from Marple and Darlington and flatmates from Cheadle use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leaving with nothing

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Bea, Kelly, John and Twon pit their wits against quiz genius the Chaser. Answering general knowledge questions, they each add as much money as they dare to the jackpot - but if anyone is caught they're out for good, leaving fewer players for the final chase

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Mary is blackmailed. Manpreet urges Rishi to give his son the full story. Gabby tries to come up with a revenge plot

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Spider races to rescue Toyah from her kidnapper, Dev thwarts Aadi's chance to spend time with Amy, and Stephen fears that his plans for Elaine are unravelling

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell report on two more cases. More than 40 years ago, Caroline Kinsey was pregnant, alone and unable to provide the kind of family and upbringing she believed all children deserved. Burdened by her heart-breaking decision to give her son up for adoption, Caroline longs to find him, to hear that he did have a happy childhood, and to know whether he can forgive her after all these years. Raised as an only child, Paul McFarlane's beloved mother died when he was nine, but years later, a single piece of paper threw all his assumptions about his small family into question

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: Exposure
programme.desc: This intimate documentary follows the story of one woman's extraordinary struggle over five years to bring the man who raped her to justice - a man accused of scores of assaults and rapes against women who applied for work at his London escort agency. The film follows 'Sam', with complete access to her story - from revealing her rape, through 18 months in a safe house and botched police investigations, to her discovery of other victims and crucial evidence

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Gary Imlach looks back at the second week of racing, as the riders recover on the second and final rest day in Saint-Gervais Mont-Blanc. With analysis from Peter Kennaugh and Ellen van Dijk, reports by Daniel Friebe and Matthew Rendell, and commentary from Ned Boulting and David Millar

programme.title: Winning Combination
programme.desc: Omid Djalili host the quiz in which nine contestants - Byron, Melanie, Harry, Sarah, Louise, Eddie, Simon, Naoise and James - are each assigned a number between one and nine, with the four that make the final trying to win the jackpot defined by those numbers. Each player's number is also the total of questions they must answer correctly in the final game against the clock

programme.title: Jason Atherton's Dubai Dishes
programme.desc: Chef Jason Atherton embarks on a culinary tour of Dubai. He explores a traditional souk in the heart of the old town, and is joined by chef Rahul Rana, who makes chocolate achappam cookies with spiced beetroot curry

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Adil Ray hosts as mother and son Natalie and Dante, husband and wife Tharun and Honey, and Jonathan and his partner Declan use their powers of deduction to try to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords

programme.title: The Chase

They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Rhona is heartbroken to see her mum so vulnerable. Bob motivates Tracy, and Laurel convinces Jai

programme.title: Paul O'Grady's Little Heroes
programme.desc: Paul hears the story of six-year-old Noah, who was born with a genetic disorder that affects the body's organs and has been referred to Great Ormond Street for the removal of his kidney, which stopped working a long time ago. The presenter also meets a couple of two-year-olds - Lucas who has a detached retina and needs laser surgery on his eye and Taylor-Rose who has accidentally swallowed a watch battery

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh creates an accessible garden in Derbyshire for Jack Parrott, a D-Day veteran approaching his 100th birthday. The team seeks out advice on clever new ways to create raised beds and patio-size greenhouses to find ways of allowing Jack to once again indulge in his life-long love of gardening

programme.title: Cooking with the Stars
programme.desc: Peter Andre, Jason Watkins and Indiyah Polack take to the kitchen, accompanied by their mentors, as they attempt to create the perfect British dish and avoid elimination in the Cook Off. Presented by Emma Willis and Tom Allen

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: The Hajj: A Journey Through Mecca
programme.desc: Shehab Khan observes the ritual of the Hajj pilgrimage to Mecca in Saudi Arabia, as around two million Muslims from around the globe attend the six-day event. Sharing personal experiences and reflections, Shehab explores the historical context of the journey and its origins, joining pilgrims as they circle the Kaaba seven times, walk between mountains, pray together and throw stones at 'Satan' - before sleeping under open sky in the desert

programme.title: Murder in the Family
programme.desc: One week into Covid lockdown, builder Rob murdered his wife Kelly and their two children, before turning the gun on himself. They had been seemingly happily married for 15 years. Elsewhere, supposedly mild-mannered Andrew Hooper stalked and shot his ex-wife Cheryl just inches away from her 14-year-old daughter. The first of this victim-led documentary series revisits events leading to the murders

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from stage 16, which consisted of a 22.4km individual time-trial from Passy to Combloux. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Peter Kennaugh and Ellen van Dijk, reports by Daniel Friebe and Matthew Rendell, and commentary from Ned Boulting and David Millar

programme.desc: The chef ends his excursion at the Bois de Boulogne, a park on the outskirts of Paris, coinciding with the hosting of a prestigious steeplechase event at its Auteuil Hippodrome. James meets fellow Yorkshireman and jockey James Revelly and rustles up leeks vinaigrette with salmon and lamb cutlets with a colourful ratatouille. Later, the chef pays a visit to the Michelin-starred Pre Catelan restaurant, where he enjoys his favourite meal of the trip

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Adil Ray in which couples from Marple and Darlington and flatmates from Cheadle use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leaving with nothing

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Bea, Kelly, John and Twon pit their wits against quiz genius the Chaser. programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell report on two more cases. More than 40 years ago, Caroline Kinsey was pregnant, alone and unable to provide the kind of family and upbringing she believed all children deserved. Burdened by her heart-breaking decision to give her son up for adoption, Caroline longs to find him, to hear that he did have a happy childhood, and to know whether he can forgive her after all these years. Raised as an only child, Paul McFarlane's beloved mother died when he was nine, but years later, a single piece of paper threw all his assumptions about his small family into question

programme.title: The Hajj: A Journey Through Mecca
programme.desc: Shehab Khan observes the ritual of the Hajj pilgrimage to Mecca in Saudi Arabia, as around two million Muslims from around the globe attend the six-day event. Sharing personal experiences and reflections, Shehab explores the historical context of the journey and its origins, joining pilgrims as they circle the Kaaba seven times, walk between mountains, pray together and throw stones at 'Satan' - before sleeping under open sky in the desert

programme.title: Murder in the Family
programme.desc: One week into Covid lockdown, builder Rob murdered his wife Kelly and their two children, before turning the gun on himself. They had been seemingly happily married for 15 years. Elsewhere, supposedly mild-mannered Andrew Hooper stalked and shot his ex-wife Cheryl just inches away from her 14-year-old daughter. The first of this victim-led documentary series revisits events leading to the murders

programme.desc: A workplace accident threatens Amy's plan to impress the district manager, Glenn tries to come off as a strict boss, while Jonah tries to help Dina win over the co-workers she betrayed in the strike. Comedy, starring America Ferrera

programme.title: Superstore
programme.desc: A situation arises when Jonah refuses to sell guns in the store, while Glenn attempts to buy the full stock of morning-after pills

programme.title: Deep Fake Neighbour Wars
programme.desc: Tyson Fury and Cardi B live next door to busy classic car mechanic Simon Cowell, and Harry Kane is in dispute with his clumsy neighbour Stormzy when Gal Gadot comes to the rescue

programme.title: Totally Bonkers Guinness World Records
programme.desc: Matt Edmonds narrates a selection of some of the most incredible and peculiar record-breaking attempts, including the most snails on one person's face, the fastest time to tape a person to a wall, and the quickest consumption of a raw onion

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: The Ropers babysit for their neighbours, but George misses his usual routine - so he nips out to a darts match with the infant in tow. Comedy, starring Brian Murphy

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: Jack returns to duty after a period of suspension, and finds himself investigating the murder of a man who had been leading a double life. In addition, he also has to deal with the baffling case of a man found dead with his right foot hacked off and replaced by a severed left foot. Drama, starring David Jason and Amanda Root

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth is asked to investigate the disappearance of a bank's most valued customer, who had been planning to sell the chairman a map showing where to find a long-lost silver mine. David Suchet stars

programme.title: Carry On Henry (1971)
programme.desc: King Henry VIII plots to rid himself of his new French wife when her craving for garlic becomes too much to cope with. However, he cannot afford to anger the king of France, and tries to make it look as if his queen has had an affair. Comedy, starring Sid James, Joan Sims, Kenneth Williams, Terry Scott, Charles Hawtrey, Barbara Windsor and Kenneth Connor

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: Millionaire's wife Mary Pritchard, a notoriously demanding invalid, apparently dies of shock in her locked room when the geranium in her wallpaper turns blue, fulfilling the dire warning of a mysterious fortune teller. The manner of her death creates a sensation in the tense village community of Little Ambrose, but although the woman's husband confesses to the crime, Miss Marple uncovers new evidence that could affect the court hearing's outcome and races to halt proceedings before the wrong person is convicted. Starring Julia McKenzie, with Toby Stephens, Sharon Small, Patrick Baladi, Caroline Catz, Claire Rushbrook and Donald Sinden

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Japp and Poirot investigate the murder of an actress's estranged husband, only to find in the theatrical world, where deception and play-acting are a way of life, nothing is quite what it seems. In time-honoured fashion, it initially looks as though the butler did it - but subsequent inquiries throw up a veritable rogues' gallery of equally likely suspects. Philip Jackson, David Suchet and Hugh Fraser star

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: An archaeologist's wife is murdered during an excavation in the Middle East. Fortunately, a vacationing Poirot - who shares with most great detectives an inability to go on holiday without stumbling over a body or two - is on hand to investigate. Mystery, starring David Suchet, with Ron Berglas, Georgina Sowerby and Iain Mitchell

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo are enlisted to design a memorial garden based on the myth of Orpheus and Eurydice, but someone begins vandalising their work on a nightly basis. Matters are complicated still further by the death of a recovering alcoholic, whose body is found at the site. Mystery drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris, with Phyllida Law, Joanna David and Daisy Dunlop

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Rosemary's old school friend Dorothy invites the duo to restore the gardens of her beautiful villa on the French Riviera so the property can be opened to the public. The plan arouses bitter hostility among the neighbours and long-held family secrets start to surface, leading to murder. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: The Larkins
programme.desc: News reaches Pop that the train station is to close. With the help of reluctant Miss Chand and villagers, Pop seizes the opportunity to save the railway - and make money along the way. Mariette fights with Pauline, and Charley makes a big decision. Bradley Walsh and Joanna Scanlan star as Pop and Ma Larkin in Simon Nye's adaptation of HE Bates's novel The Darling Buds of May

programme.title: The Savoy
programme.desc: A look at preparations for the festive period at the London hotel, which begin in mid-November when staff work through the night to transform the hotel into a winter wonderland. Guest experience manager Sean is scheduled to have his first Christmas off in 10 years and is on a mission to ensure his new butler team is ready for the big day, but will staff sickness ruin his festive plans?

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: The son of a high-profile Jewish businessman is attacked in the grounds of a university, leaving Foyle to consider the possibility that the attack was racially motivated. Meanwhile, in London, tensions mount as charismatic right-wing leader Guy Spencer is released from prison. But is he being set up to take the spotlight off a dangerous espionage operation involving MI6? Elsewhere, Sam becomes acutely aware of the impact of the war on Adam's constituents as she encounters a young boy suffering from whooping cough. Michael Kitchen stars in the 1940s-set crime drama, with Honeysuckle Weeks and Daniel Weyman

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Hudson is angered by James's decision to invite his father's secretary to lunch in the family dining room, and promptly tenders his resignation. Shortly after his wife leaves for New York, Richard receives the news that his work is to be published and wires her aboard the ship she is travelling on - the RMS Titanic

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Dr Ormerod returns to work after his accident, but when his brusque treatment of a hypochondriac schoolgirl ends in tragedy, it's clear he still needs time to recover. New nurse Catherine Deane starts her rounds on the wards, and Mr Middleditch has a surprise announcement to make. Robert Daws, Amelia Curtis and Ian Carmichael star

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Mr Middleditch brings his reign to an end and hands over the ledgers to the new administrator - having craftily secured the hospital's future. Dr Ormerod's plaster comes off, Mr Rose risks his own skin to save a friend during a game of golf, and a trivial accident leads a family to make a major and heartbreaking discovery. Ian Carmichael, Robert Cavanah, Robert Daws and Wendy Craig star

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: After enjoying a trip to the theatre with Captain Hastings, the detective is disturbed by the sound of gunshots in an apartment at Whitehaven Mansions, and soon finds himself investigating a murder. Drama, starring David Suchet, Hugh Fraser and Philip Jackson

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian sleuth takes a break on the island of Rhodes, where an English beauty draws attention by flirting with fellow guests at the Palace Hotel. When she is found murdered, her husband is immediately suspected, but Poirot quickly deduces there is more to the case than a simple crime of passion. Whodunit, starring David Suchet

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: Eagle-eyed George sees an investment opportunity when Mildred suggests their dog should have puppies. Comedy, starring Brian Murphy and Yootha Joyce

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Bernice prepares to leave, but cannot bear to say goodbye to Gabby and decides to tell Ashley she will be taking their daughter to Brighton

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Robert makes a grand romantic gesture in a bid to woo Katie, while Diane's preparations for her engagement party are thrown into disarray

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Mick pulls a driver over for running a red light, only to discover it's Les Battersby, who starts to goad him about Janice, prompting the cop to embark on a frenzied attack

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Emma is angered by Mick's attack on Les. Peter regrets his actions towards Shelley and assures her he wants to marry her

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: George buys a pair of homing pigeons with which to annoy his next door neighbours, after Mildred accidentally flushes his beloved goldfish down the sink. Brian Murphy stars

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: A valuable heirloom brought back from the China Sea could change the Ropers' fortunes - but not if Mildred's sister gets it first. Starring Brian Murphy and Yootha Joyce

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A local nightclub owner is admitted with symptoms of poisoning, and his son is quick to point the finger of suspicion at his father's glamorous wife. Frankie is shocked to see Dr Ormerod doubt himself as they tend a drunken farmer after a tractor accident, while Dr Goodwin deals with a case of domestic abuse and a stationery salesman takes a shine to Lizzie. Robert Daws and Scott Taylor star

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Dr Goodwin is accused of taking sides when he goes too far to help a woman who claims her husband is hitting her, and there is a mystery to solve when a patient is admitted under a false name. Meanwhile, Dr Ormerod's strange behaviour shows signs of becoming worse - and Frankie fears the surgeon is becoming addicted to his medication. Medical drama, with Robert Daws, Wendy Craig and Amy Robbins

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Merton organises a search of the moors after a farming couple are reported missing, leaving Jenny and Liz to look after their bemused children. Meanwhile, a reluctant Bernie is taken on a mini break to a country hotel by Vernon - but he grows increasingly dismayed over the plans for a new garage. Rural drama, starring Geoffrey Hughes, Duncan Bell and Sarah Tansey

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Lord Ashfordly's sister arrives in Aidensfield with a renowned Polish violinist and his daughter, intending to stage a concert at the village hall. Disaster strikes when an expensive instrument is stolen - and romance blossoms for Steve as he steps in to investigate the theft. Meanwhile, a shady father-and-son duo set their scheming sights on Vernon. Drama, starring James Carlton and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Diane warns Jack not to be fooled by Val's charms, and Nicola prepares dinner for Simon, while Andy agrees to accept a week of dares from Robert in the run-up to his stag night

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Val's ex-boyfriend turns up and reveals the real story behind her facial bruising, while Katie and Andy grow increasingly nervous as their big day draws closer

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Les continues to claim he is the victim of police brutality, Tyrone and Katy face the music with Mike, and Shelley looks to the future with Peter

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Tyrone pleads his innocence over Mike's missing money, but the Underworld boss will have none of it and issues him with an ultimatum

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The detective is ordered to take a holiday for the benefit of his health, and with Hastings and Miss Lemon in tow, reluctantly heads for the tranquillity of Devon's coast, where his relaxation is soon ruined by the discovery of a socialite's murdered body on the beach. Several people had reason for wishing Arlena Stuart dead, but high on the list of suspects are her husband, teenage son and a troubled vicar. David Suchet, Hugh Fraser, Philip Jackson and Pauline Moran star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Sgt Merton finds himself under pressure when teenagers commit serious offences in the area and must race to stop a planned 'chicken run' with stolen cars. The youngsters are also suspected of drug dealing after Liz Merrick hands in amphetamines found in a local boy's bedroom, and Merton's investigative techniques lead Jenny to call off the wedding. Starring Duncan Bell, Sarah Tansey and Aislin McGuckin

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: PC Steve Crane takes an urgent phone call, and is shocked to discover Peter Pyke's warehouse has gone up in smoke. It soon emerges that the owner's wife had spent time behind bars for fraud, and her husband is reluctant to answer questions - leading Merton to suspect the blaze was deliberate. Meanwhile, Vernon moves into his new mansion, but has trouble keeping up with his well-to-do neighbours. Rural drama, starring James Carlton, Duncan Bell and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: A mysterious fire that killed an artist with links to political activists leaves the police baffled, while Bright finds himself short-staffed when a stomach bug puts most of his men on sick leave. The situation becomes more serious when a housewife dies of the same condition. Endeavour investigates a family-run supermarket, believing the infection may have stemmed from their stock being deliberately contaminated, and discovers dark secrets that may have a connection to the unexplained blaze

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: A pregnant junior doctor is found beaten to death in a hospital car park, and her boyfriend Joe Nash becomes the prime suspect when he cannot provide an alibi. Brooks and Devlin begin to think Nash is having an affair with his therapist, but what initially seems like a crime of passion unravels into a conspiracy involving senior government officials, with Steel and Phillips risking their careers to find the truth. Bradley Walsh, Jamie Bamber and Matthew McNulty star

programme.desc: DS Jenn Townsend receives an emergency call and races to the scene to find horror unfolding for a broken family. Starring Marsha Thomason, Kerrie Taylor and Karl Davies

programme.desc: Jealousy gets the better of Steve when Karen sets off on her business trip with Joe, so he goes to drown his sorrows

The detective agrees to investigate, but warns his client that he may discover things she does not want to hear. David Suchet stars, with Rachael Stirling, Aidan Gillen, Aimee Mullens, Toby Stephens, Gemma Jones, Patrick Malahide and Annette Badland

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Liz Merrick faces a trying time when one of her patients misses an appointment to discuss medication, and subsequently ends up charged with drink-driving, while Vernon's pal David is kidnapped and held to ransom. Merton is delighted Jenny has agreed to marry him, and Bellamy finds out that Gina is carrying his baby. Rural drama, starring Aislin McGuckin, Geoffrey Hughes and Duncan Bell

programme.desc: An old friend of Merton is sent from CID to help track down a bank robber, and he agrees to be best man at the wedding, while Jenny's disgraced brother Steve tries to patch things up with his sister before she ties the knot. Guest starring Fay Ripley (Cold Feet), with Neil Dudgeon and Jason Hughes

programme.desc: When a teenager with severe learning difficulties is killed in a fire at his home, Brooks and Devlin's investigation leads them to the last person they thought could be responsible. Bradley Walsh, Jamie Bamber and Ben Daniels star

At half-power, Sam behaves like a computer virus - and infects her teacher's computer...

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Brick wants a volunteer for a 'Nap Experiment' at school, a protocol which he hopes can improve his students' learning capacities. Mo volunteers, along with loads of other kids. Faced with so many volunteers, Brick proposes to choose the candidate via a lucky draw. Mo desperately wants to be chosen. He decides to favour his chances by asking the Scepter for the power of luck. But the half power means that he and Sam alternate between good luck... and bad luck.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo and Guess Who?

programme.title: Jamie's One-Pan Wonders

programme.title: Exploring India's Treasures with Bettany Hughes
programme.desc: Part two of two. Bettany travels to Thanjavur, also known at Tanjore, which was once the capital of the Chola empire, one of the longest ruling dynasties in world history. She explores the 10th-century Brihadeeswarar Temple, before taking the Nilgiri Mountain Railway, an outstanding example of an innovative transportation system built through uneven and challenging terrain. Bettany's adventure in the Malabar Coast finishes aboard one of Kerala's famous houseboats

programme.title: Rocketman (2019)
programme.desc: Elton John enters an addiction rehabilitation session, and recounts his life in a flashback, covering his days as young Reginald Dwight growing up in 1950s Britain. He takes piano lessons, makes his way into the Royal Academy of Music, and hones his craft in local pubs before becoming one of the world's biggest pop stars. Golden Globe-winning biopic, starring Taron Egerton, Jamie Bell and Richard Madden

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox

programme.title: Sloborn

In German, Danish and French

programme.title: Glass (2019)

They find themselves under the care of a sinister doctor who has plans concerning their unique abilities, but also sharing the facility with a third patient, a criminal mastermind the crime fighter had encountered before, and who is soon manipulating everyone to his own ends. M Night Shyamalan's fantasy thriller, crossing over the characters from his earlier films Unbreakable and Split. Starring James McAvoy, Bruce Willis and Samuel L Jackson

programme.desc: Lady of leisure Jill is second to host in and around Blackpool and Preston, leaving no stone unturned in her effort to impress her guests with an Italian-themed menu

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: First of a two-part special taking viewers behind the scenes of a Cambridgeshire police investigation into a woman who is plotting to have her ex-husband killed. The keepers worry that he is lacking in confidence and hope that offering the king and his pride a larger new habitat will turn him into a more commanding ruler. But things do not go quite as planned. Territorial disputes among the male vampire crabs have resulted in a bloodbath, so night-time cameras are set up to determined the catch the culprit, affable Andean bear Bernie has been banished to the next-door paddock by his grumpy mate Lima and pygmy marmoset Baldrick needs to stand up to the lion tamarins sharing his quarters

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets a master craftsman whose dream is to build a castle in rural Devon made entirely of mud. Kevin McCabe plans to form the huge property out of two vast curved roundhouses - the largest of which is inspired by the natural geometry of a snail shell - connected by glazing and topped with wildflower meadow roofs to mirror the surrounding countryside. However, the project involves mixing and laying a mind-boggling 2,000 tons of cob, all during warm, sunny weather - and the sheer scale of the task soon becomes clear

programme.desc: Rachel loses Ross's pet monkey, prompting the gang to form a search party to find it, but an animal warden with a grudge gets in the way. Comedy, starring Jennifer Aniston and David Schwimmer

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Rookie team member Rachael faces a baptism of fire on a night shift, from a face-off with a driver threatening her colleague Lee's family, to the pursuit of a high-speed Mercedes carrying with a pregnant passenger. Elsewhere, Liam plays a pitch-black game of hunt the knife in the aftermath of a terrifying armed robbery, dog handler Mo deals with a double fire before arresting a man who appears to be stealing from a phone box, and a motorist picks up the phone and calls the police to report interceptor Chris for stealing his car

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: A failure to stop in Hartlepool turns into an armed stand-off and a full-blown kidnapping situation, while a 14-year-old boy is found in possession of a bag of crack cocaine, cash and a knife. Lee goes on a high-speed pursuit through Stockton, and Jacko and Simon tackle a drug driver who is wearing a balaclava

programme.title: Inside the Tower of London
programme.desc: The stories behind some of the most dramatic escape attempts from the tower, including Henry Howard, who tried to avoid execution by making his way through the sewage system. In the present day, curator Sally Dixon-Smith deciphers some graffiti by a Tudor mystic who mysteriously disappeared, while Yeoman warder Chris Clawson reveals why the tower is still a spooky place to work in after dark

programme.title: Inside the Tower of London
programme.desc: The story of Lady Jane Grey's brief rule as queen and execution in the Tower. Chief curator Tracy Borman explores how Edward VI's will placed her on the throne while still in her teens, only for the dead king's sister Mary to proclaim herself queen in defiance of his wishes, but with great public support. The programme features footage of the annual flower-laying ceremony on the anniversary of Jane's death

programme.title: The Great Plague: New Evidence
programme.desc: Xand van Tulleken, Raksha Dave and John Sergeant trace the spread of the Great Plague of 1665 week by week and discover parallels with the Covid-19 pandemic. The epidemic is traced back to its source in the parish of St Giles in the Fields, now at the heart of London's theatre district, and the presenters also examine the symptoms of the disease and uncover new research into the plague bacteria that could overthrow accepted ideas about how it was spread

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: When... Goes Horribly Wrong
programme.desc: Paul Merton narrates a compilation of clips from disastrous motorhome holidays, including a campervan invaded by giant spiders, a tyre blowing out at high speed on a motorway, and holidaymakers in the Lake District getting into trouble as they drive up Hardknott Pass

programme.title: Million Pound Motorhomes
programme.desc: Celebrating the Great British obsession with all things motorhome. TV presenter Jenny Powell and her family head to the Lake District in their beloved campervan. Despite the terrible weather they still take the plunge, but can Jenny convince daughter Pollyanna to join them? At the UK's biggest expo, the Caravan, Camping and Motorhome Show at Birmingham's NEC, managing director Terry prepares to open the doors to the public - but every detail must be spot on to make this year's event as successful as last year's

programme.title: Coastguard: Search & Rescue SOS
programme.desc: In Wales, the Coastguard Rescue Helicopter from Caernarfon is tasked with helping a kite surfer in trouble at sea. Elsewhere in Newquay, a 999 call comes in from an individual who has been caught out by the incoming tide after going for a swim and is alone among hazardous rocks, and in Fareham, a fishing vessel triggers a distress signal

programme.title: Police: Hour of Duty
programme.desc: A specialist taskforce prepares to raid a premises with suspected links to an organised crime gang, and fear they may come under attack as they try and force entry. A woman calls 999 reporting that her son's car has been petrol bombed outside her house

programme.title: Police Code Zero: Officer Under Attack
programme.desc: Two officers are called to a property in Llanelli and are taken by surprise when a man armed with a knife runs out of the house and threatens them, while in Stoke-on-Trent Sgt Durose and a colleague resppond to a 99 call to find a man with a knife is holding a woman hostage and threatening all and sundry

programme.title: Inside HMP Whitemoor: Evil Behind Bars
programme.desc: Documentary examining the Category A prison in Cambridgeshire, which was built to be an escape-proof fortress and houses some of the country's most violent men, who are inside for running organised crime networks in Britain and around the world. As Britain moved into the 21st century, the prison incarcerated more Islamic terrorists - a global sign of the times - and a new approach was needed to combat this type of extremism

programme.title: Live: Lost Dogs with Clare Balding
programme.desc: In a live television first, Clare Balding rallies the support of the great British public to help reunite lost dogs with their owners, tracking down a selection of dogs that have been separated from their heartbroken families for weeks, months, and, in some cases, years. She also showcases several stray dogs that have been handed into rescue centres across the UK, and whose owners cannot be located. Tonight, reporter Storm Huntley also visits the Isle of Wight to meet a family who spent six years looking for their beloved stolen spaniel Fern, and JB Gill heads to Cornwall to train with sniffer dogs who are experts in tracking other dogs that are lost

programme.title: The Great Flood of '53
programme.desc: Looking back at the deadly floods that devastated England's east coast in January 1953, the worst natural disaster to strike Britain in modern times. Across a day of destruction, a massive storm and its huge tidal surge flooded 250 square miles of land, killing hundreds of people, sinking several ships and destroying tens of thousands of homes

programme.desc: Europe, 20,000 years ago, and a young man is left for dead while hunting with his tribe. After forming an alliance with a lone wolf that was abandoned by its pack, the duo attempts to make their way to safety. Prehistoric adventure, starring Kodi Smit-McPhee and Jhannes Haukur Jhannesson. Directed by Albert Hughes (The Book of Eli)

programme.title: Turner & Hooch (1989)
programme.desc: A Californian detective investigating the murder of a local man by drug smugglers has only one witness to help him solve the case - the large, smelly dog that belonged to the victim, which is about to turn the detective's well-ordered existence into chaos. Family comedy, starring Tom Hanks, Mare Winningham and Craig T Nelson

programme.title: Monster Trucks (2016)
programme.desc: A drilling operation unleashes a subterranean creature which feeds on oil. The monster bonds with a monster truck which a local teenager is building from spare parts, and the youngster befriends the beast and helps it to return to its underground home. Fantasy adventure, starring Lucas Till and Jane Levy

programme.title: GI Joe: The Rise of Cobra (2009)
programme.desc: When a powerful experimental weapon is snatched by a mysterious terrorist organisation, two of the soldiers guarding it are recruited into a top-secret military strike force. As they go in search of the stolen technology, they uncover a plot by its creator to take over the world. Action adventure, with Channing Tatum, Sienna Miller and Christopher Eccleston

programme.title: Independence Day: Resurgence (2016)
programme.desc: Two decades have passed since Earth was saved from an extraterrestrial invasion, and in the years since, the aliens' salvaged technology has been used to transform the world. However, it may not be enough to save the human race when a second, even deadlier attack begins. Sci-fi adventure, starring Jeff Goldblum, Liam Hemsworth and Bill Pullman

programme.title: Hitman (2007)
programme.desc: A genetically engineered assassin, who exists at the beck and call of a mysterious organisation, fails in his latest mission, and becomes a target himself, as security forces worldwide become aware of his existence and a rival agent is assigned to tie up loose ends. Action thriller, starring Timothy Olyphant, Dougray Scott and Olga Kurylenko

programme.title: Better Things (2008)
programme.desc: The residents of a small Cotswolds town lead troubled lives, including a recently hospitalised woman trying to connect with her reclusive sister, a couple whose marriage is falling apart and a bereaved man turning to drugs to cope with his loss. Drama, starring Patricia Loveland, Rachel McIntyre and Liam McIlfatrick

programme.title: BSL Zone: Coffee Morning Club
programme.desc: Dave's plan to save the Deaf Club backfires dramatically

programme.title: The Last Hurrah (1958)
programme.desc: John Ford's political drama, starring Spencer Tracy as a headstrong New England mayor who launches one final re-election campaign. However, he finds the nature of politics is changing and that he has a powerful enemy in a wealthy and influential local banker (Basil Rathbone). Also starring Jeffrey Hunter and Pat O'Brien

programme.title: All the King's Men (1949)
programme.desc: A small-town senator wins popular support by railing against the corruption of the political establishment and vowing to defend the interests of ordinary working people. However, once in office, he succumbs to greed as readily as those he once so virulently condemned. Political drama, starring Broderick Crawford, Joanne Dru, John Ireland and Mercedes McCambridge

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Dead Reckoning Part 1 Interview Special
programme.desc: Tom Cruise, Hayley Atwell, Simon Pegg and director Christopher McQuarrie talk about the spectacular seventh film in the action-adventure series

programme.title: Samson and Delilah (1949)
programme.desc: Hebrew warrior Samson becomes a wanted man after crossing paths with Philistine troops, but he constantly thwarts their efforts to capture him using to his incredible strength. Determined to bring him down, the Saran of Gaza makes use of his beguiling sister Delilah, who seduces Samson and manages to rob him of the source of his power. Cecil B DeMille's Oscar-winning adaptation of the biblical tale, starring Victor Mature, Hedy Lamarr, George Sanders, Angela Lansbury and Henry Wilcox

programme.title: The Legend of Zorro (2005)
programme.desc: The masked hero investigates a mysterious explosion linked to a French count, who is plotting to prevent California joining the United States - and discovers his wife, who walked out on their marriage when he refused to hang up his sword, is somehow involved. Swashbuckling adventure sequel, starring Antonio Banderas, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Rufus Sewell, Alberto Reyes and Adrian Alonso

programme.title: Gemini Man (2019)
programme.desc: An aging assassin is targeted by a mysterious young operative that seems able to anticipate his every move. Discovering that he's being hunted by a younger clone of himself, Henry needs to find out why he's being targeted and who the creator is. Action drama, starring Will Smith, Mary Elizabeth Winstead and Clive Owen

programme.title: War of the Worlds (2005)
programme.desc: A divorced father's rare weekend with his two estranged children descends into horror when alien war machines rise from beneath Earth and begin to systematically destroy every human being in their path - leaving the man with the dangerous task of getting his kids to safety. Steven Spielberg's sci-fi thriller, based on HG Wells' novel, with Tom Cruise, Dakota Fanning, Justin Chatwin, Miranda Otto and Tim Robbins

programme.title: Cube (1997)
programme.desc: Seven disparate strangers awake in a bizarre labyrinth laced with deadly traps, and face the fight of their lives to regain their freedom. Sci-fi horror filmed on one set, starring Nicole deBoer, Nicky Guadagni, David Hewlett and Andrew Miller

programme.title: The Mouse That Roared (1959)
programme.desc: The leaders of the tiny European duchy of Grand Fenwick decide to solve their bankruptcy problem by declaring war on the USA. They confidently expect to lose and thereby qualify for economic aid - but the plan takes an unexpected turn for the worse when the Americans surrender. Comedy, starring Peter Sellers in three roles, with Jean Seberg, William Hartnell, David Kossoff and Leo McKern

programme.title: 3:10 to Yuma (1957)
programme.desc: A farmer in need of money agrees to guard a notorious outlaw until the train arrives to transport him to jail. Meanwhile, the pair are holed up in a hotel, where his prisoner plays mind games with him - and the villain's cohorts are waiting outside ready to engineer an escape. Western adapted from a novel by Elmore Leonard, with Van Heflin, Glenn Ford, Felicia Farr and Leora Dana

programme.title: Detective Story (1951)
programme.desc: A moralistic New York cop is determined to ensure the conviction of an illegal abortionist implicated in the deaths of several women. However, his obsession leads him to lose control, and he is disturbed to discover his own wife was once one of the doctor's patients - a secret she had kept from him. Police drama, starring Kirk Douglas, Eleanor Parker and William Bendix

programme.title: Arizona Raiders (1965)
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the American Civil War, two Confederate soldiers are offered a way out of jail. Their former comrades-in-arms are now a gang of bandits terrorising Arizona, and the two prisoners are sent to infiltrate the group and bring them to justice. Western, starring Audie Murphy, Buster Crabbe, Ben Cooper and Gloria Talbott

programme.title: Gods of Egypt (2016)
programme.desc: An ancient Egyptian god is driven into exile when his evil brother murders their father and seizes his throne. He enlists the aid of a human thief in restoring justice, and in return offers to help the mortal to bring his murdered lover back to life. Fantasy adventure, starring Nikolaj Coster-Waldau, Brenton Thwaites, Gerard Butler and Chadwick Boseman

Director Chad Stahelski's action thriller sequel, starring Keanu Reeves, Halle Berry and Ian McShane

programme.title: The Hunt (2019)
programme.desc: A group of elites gather for the first time at a remote manor house to hunt ordinary Americans for sport. However, the elites' master plan is about to be derailed because one of the hunted, Crystal, knows the hunters' game better than they do, and turns the tables on the killers as she makes her way toward the mysterious woman at the centre of the mystery. Director Craig Zobel's horror thriller, starring Betty Gilpin, Hilary Swank and Emma Roberts

programme.title: The Exorcism of Emily Rose (2005)
programme.desc: A student dies after an attempted exorcism by a priest who was convinced she was possessed by evil spirits. A sceptical lawyer is assigned to defend the cleric against the charge of manslaughter, but as the case unfolds she finds her own convictions challenged. Horror drama, starring Tom Wilkinson, Laura Linney, Jennifer Carpenter, Campbell Scott and Colm Feore

Animated comedy, with the voices of Kevin James, Courteney Cox, Sam Elliott, Danny Glover and Andie MacDowell

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Florida to help the owners of Fleming, a Danish restaurant in Miami. With a Cuban chef cooking Nordic cuisine and a filthy kitchen, things go from bad to worse until it all comes to a head on relaunch night

Meanwhile in Buckinghamshire, George meets the owners of an 18th century gatehouse who need help changing the layout of their living room

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In north Surrey, planning enforcement officer Becky is joined by singing teacher Petrina, drum teacher Rob, solicitor Shoba and building company boss Giovanni. Becky plans to delight her guests with an evening of modern home-cooking and a menu including butternut, lamb and a deconstructed apple dessert. The week gets off to an intriguing start with young gun Rob taking a shine to Petrina and vice versa

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Solicitor Shoba hosts the second night in north Surrey, and tries to impress with an Indian-themed menu. However, the guests are less than impressed with the food, especially the main course - a curry made from frozen fish - but will a bit of belly dancing, Bollywood-style, help save the day? Meanwhile, singer Petrina and drummer Rob continue their flirting both at and away from the table

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Drum tutor Rob hosts the third night in north Surrey, hoping his Thai-themed menu will impress his guests, as well as the object of his affections, Petrina. He serves prawns with lemon, lime and chilli for his starter, Thai chicken curry for his main, and rounds off with his own take on an ice-cream sundae. As a single man living in his stepmother's house, Rob thinks his competitors will see him as an underdog, so is intent on pulling out all the stops

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Singing teacher Petrina hosts the fourth dinner party in north Surrey, and she believes her experience of entertaining on cruise ships will give her the edge as she plans a showstopper of an evening. However, the diners seem more interested in their host's continued flirting with fellow guest Rob. Will tonight be the night, or will he shy away when he discovers Petrina has sung in the West End and worked with dozens of household names?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Giovanni hosts the final night of the competition in north Surrey, intent on flying the flag for Sicily with some family inspired recipes. Even with help from his father, a tagliatelle tragedy leaves him with Parmesan on his face. Becky is less than impressed with Giovanni's dishes, and matters go from bad to worse when he attempts to serve his home-made pasta. However, poor food doesn't deter a romantic Rob from popping the question to Petrina, sending shockwaves across the dining room. In a final attempt to bag the 1,000, Giovanni invites an opera singer to liven up the proceedings, but his musical initiative may prove too little to save the day

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at the Buck Inn in Malham, North Yorkshire, where mother-and-daughter team Karen and Kathryn Souter hope their B&B will impress their guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves to Smithson Farm in Reedley Hallows, Lancashire, where Carole and Harry Johnson hope their glampsite gives their guests a taste of the great outdoors

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to Mallard House in Gilling West, North Yorkshire, where manager Olivia Skeoch and head of housekeeping Teresa Weedon hope their guests will lap up the luxury

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to Dick and Liz Bradley's B&B, Bryn Derwen in Rhayader, Powys, where it's all about the home-from-home experience. Harry and Carole appear to have found the perfect match but for Kathryn, the decor is disappointing. At dinner, the B&Bers reflect on the week and talk about keeping in touch, but there's an uncomfortable silence from one end of the table

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time and things get personal when Olivia and Teresa of Mallard House take Harry and Carole to task over their feedback. After dramatic discoveries and cutting comments, the payments are revealed and the winner is announced

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Guildford, Surrey, the first host is glamorous 22-year-old cosmetic-surgery-fan Shanice, who hopes to show she is more than just a pretty face by serving up sumptuous food and dazzling conversation. The guests she must impress are 32-year-old entertainer David, 69-year-old Norwegian plain-talker Vivi, 47-year-old super-competitive Neil and 25-year-old media sales worker Charlotte. With risky menu choices and a fellow diner's peculiar laughter taking the spotlight, will the conversations ranging from lookalikes to riding polar bears be enough to secure Shanice the prize?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Retired estate agent Vivi hosts the second dinner party in and around Guildford. She is convinced her experience and original Scandinavian fayre can beat her less experienced competition and the soiree features Norwegian fish soup, ghost stories, ghost impressions, Norwegian singing and nursery rhymes

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Sales manager Charlotte hosts the third night of a week of dinner parties in and around Guildford, hoping to impress her guests enough to win the 1,000 prize money. However, she has taken a huge risk with an Asian-inspired menu, which could prove to be too exotic for entertainments manager David

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The penultimate day in and around Guildford, Surrey, sees children's entertainments manager David playing host. Having worked in the entertainments industry all his life, he is no stranger to showing people a good time, and employs his colleagues to put on a performance, while keeping his food simple. Is he forgetting the key ingredients of a dinner party?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the final day in and around Guildford, Surrey, sales director Neil devises a sophisticated menu, dismissing his predecessors' efforts as unambitious. However, his unusual fayre is tempered by his choice of yodelling entertainment, which threatens to hinder his chance of scooping the 1,000 prize

programme.title: PopMaster TV
programme.desc: Ken Bruce tests more music lovers from all across the UK in the second heat as they fight to secure a place in the final

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Cameras follow junior doctor Ming, who for the first time in his career carries out a needle aspiration on a 19-year-old patient brought into A&E with a collapsed lung. A woman who is 17 weeks pregnant falls down the stairs, and fears the accident may lead to a possible miscarriage. She recounts her struggles to conceive, and fears that if this pregnancy fails, she may never have a child

programme.title: The Emergency Ward
programme.desc: A man collapses in the hospital cafe. Luckily, it's next to the Emergency Department, but Dr Jonathan fears that the man's luck is running out. Meanwhile, Dr Laura and Dr Mark bend over backwards to perform what should be a routine procedure on a woman with a dislocated hip

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: Malcolm, who has had a cardiac arrest, is put under emergency anaesthetic on the hospital helipad. Helicopter medics rush to help elderly driver Bill after his car flips in Whitley Bay. In Oxfordshire, a sidecar race comes to an abrupt end for brothers Paul and Shane

programme.title: The Good Doctor
programme.desc: Shaun bonds with a young patient who has the rare neurological disorder Moebius syndrome. Medical drama, starring Freddie Highmore

programme.title: The Emergency Ward
programme.desc: A man collapses in the hospital cafe. Luckily, it's next to the Emergency Department, but Dr Jonathan fears that the man's luck is running out. Meanwhile, Dr Laura and Dr Mark bend over backwards to perform what should be a routine procedure on a woman with a dislocated hip

A woman who is 17 weeks pregnant falls down the stairs, and fears the accident may lead to a possible miscarriage. programme.title: Food Unwrapped

programme.title: Kirstie's House of Craft

Now they are taking the plunge and have asked Ben Hillman to find their dream home in the province of Mlaga. They'd love to settle in a traditional Spanish village and are looking for a three-bedroom character property. Ben lines up five options within their budget of 100,000

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: In Portugal, a family dream of a new eco-friendly life. In France, a couple struggle to get their B&B ready for guests, and in Spain, a bike business starts again after Covid

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon O'Brien and Henry Cole head to Surrey and Hampshire. Simon builds a huge kitchen table from discarded rafters and gives a 1970s campervan a new lease of life. Henry hankers after an American tractor and Royal Enfield motorbike and sidecar

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: The programme heads to Lowestoft in Suffolk, where Henry Cole picks a valuable Lyons Tea enamel sign while Simon O'Brien converts a station trolley into a garden sofa

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate researchers solve a 20-year-old case and reveal the story of a pilot who died in the final days of the Second World War. Plus, retired weather presenter Michael Fish discovers his family history and learns he is the heir to an unclaimed estate

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate researchers try to track down the relatives of a Liverpudlian woman, and uncover the surprising connection between the site of a Welsh school and a former president of America. Plus, the details of unclaimed estates for which heirs still need to be found

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at St Hilary Guest House in Llandudno, where owner Tricia Watson and her daughter Jess hope their classic seaside destination will win over their guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second of this week's destinations is The Falcon Retreat in south Wales, run by Sue Burston and her right-hand woman Linda Roberts. When the guests arrive at the secluded location, Darren and Alex are wowed by the view, but there are some issues in their room. At dinner, the guests are surprised by their hosts' previous professions, and a conversation about the additional charge for breakfast worries Sue and Linda

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at the Crown Inn in Grewelthorpe, North Yorkshire, where owners Debbie Heartfield and Paul Dixon hope to impress their guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final venue is Stix Glamping in Greetham, Rutland, where one guest decides glamping is not for her before she has even set foot on site, leaving her partner all alone

programme.title: Four in a Bed

St Hilary Guest House is first and owner Tricia Watson and daughter Jess heat things up over a cold shower. programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: The zebras have a newcomer to their herd, Okoth, who starts to make a play for power, which does not go down well with zebra Florence. Meanwhile, Keeper Isolde comes up with an unusual plan to give the zoo's three Komodo dragon sisters some much needed space from each other, and Chester's male lemurs are in for a shock with a female on her way to share their island

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Members of the Fullagar family get more than they bargained for when they are introduced to father and daughter, Pepe and Tink - who can't be separated. Meanwhile, Louise and Angela are conflicted when Trinity a five-month-old lurcher puppy shows off both her adorable side and an impressive ability to chew everything from furniture to shoes

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Professional deep-sea diver Adrian Corrigall and his wife Megan plan to build their new family home in rural East Sussex almost entirely out of concrete, with construction involving cutting-edge technologies conceived in Switzerland and never used to build a house before. However, the perils of being a pioneer soon become evident, and with both schedule and budget under strain, Adrian is forced to resume work as a diver, taking him away from the project for a month at a time

programme.desc: Jamie Oliver presents recipes that keep costs under control in the kitchen. programme.desc: A cautionary roll-call of nautical nightmares demonstrating what can happen when people venture out on water. From vast cruise ships and ferries pounded by extraordinary weather, to near-death experiences on board vessels that catch fire and sink, the documentary reveals incredible moments, as told by the survivors, while psychologists discuss the seaborne anxieties people could experience on vessels ranging from the largest ships to small canoes

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A London Underground worker undergoes tests to look for signs of a heart attack after collapsing at a Tube station, and recalls the difficulties he faced in his childhood. programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics

With a budget of 140,000, Danni shows them five suitable properties

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: Storms wreak havoc for a family at their rural retreat in Portugal, while a plumping problem plagues a chateau B&B in France. In Spain, a bike business finally starts trading again

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: The duo rummage through the hangar of a Vulcan bomber, where Henry finds a cockpit seat to restore, and Simon attempts to turn part of a jet engine into a coffee table

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole builds a steampunk lamp from a copper electric central heating pipe and Simon O'Brien modernises a dated Welsh dresser during visits to Whitby and Shipley in Yorkshire

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate researchers look into the case of a former member of the Royal College of Surgeons, and race to discover the rightful owners of his inheritance. The team also investigates the case of a woman whose father was a famous pigeon fancier. Plus, details of some unclaimed estates requiring heirs

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate researchers try to track down the relatives of a man whose family was involved in the textile trade, and there is a look at the story of Jewish artist Jehuda Epstein, whose paintings were among thousands of artworks plundered by the Nazis during the Second World War

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off in rural Co Durham at Bowlees Farm Holiday Cottages, where married couple Tony and Viv Smith hope that their tranquil setting, private hot tubs and indoor swimming pool will leave their guests feeling as though they've died and gone to Durham. At first, their guests are bowled over by the views and the facilities but on closer inspection, friends Jane and Rachel find fault with the cleanliness in the kitchen. At dinner, it's revealed that breakfast will be provided by the local farm shop a mile down the road, the only facility that Tony and Viv don't seem to have. Despite the clean plates, married couple Amanda and Howard make their feelings clear on the lack of options. At feedback, the price tag of a fully equipped cottage proves to be too much to warrant a return visit for some

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to the Piebald Inn in Hunmanby, North Yorkshire, where the lack of a thermostat and a divisive design idea irritate some of the guests

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin meets south London chef Corinne, who loves to entertain and is rustling up plans for a beautifully crafted, double-kitchen home designed around her love of cooking. The end-of-terrace plot is on a hill and surrounded by woodland within a strict conservation area, so it won't be an easy build. But having come through a divorce and cancer treatment, Corinne sees the house as vital on so many levels, not least as an opportunity to create a space that represents her new lease of life

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Stoke-on-Trent to Winsford, Cheshire, finding out about one of the greatest locomotive factories in railway history along the way.
