programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Dudley in the West Midlands to Bridgnorth, Shropshire. He learns how Victorian blacksmithing was not for the faint-hearted, rides on one of Britain's most modern trains and traverses the Victoria Bridge at Bewdley in Worcestershire

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Welshpool, Powys, to Aberystwyth in Ceredigion. He experiences Victorian entertainment in one of Wales's best-loved resorts, hears how the railways took the country's textiles into the most exclusive households and unleashes the power of a 19th-century engineering triumph

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the next stage of his journey in which he travels from the naval hub of Portsmouth to Grimsby docks. On the first leg, he helps feed the crew of Britain's newest battleship, discovers how the Victorians planned to repel a possible French invasion and learns there is a well-established industry in an unlikely location

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Woking in Surrey to Clapham Junction in south London. Along the way he gets close to some precious Victorian botany at Kew Gardens, tries his hand at croquet and discovers a very surprising 19th-century place of worship

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from London's King's Cross to Peterborough and discovers how a derelict part of the capital is being rejuvenated. He also puts in a shift at a Cambridgeshire brick factory and meets members of an immigrant community linked to it

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris travels through the Middle East to explore what remains of the colonial railways, which were built there more than 100 years ago. In the Wadi Rum valley, Chris boards a steam train along one of the few bits of the Hejaz railway that remains in working use, following the route through Jordan, before crossing the border into Israel as he heads for Jerusalem, which is sacred to more than half of the world's population. Along the way, Chris visits the ancient city of Petra, as well as Haifa and Tel Aviva

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris sets out on a mission to cross three former Soviet republics entirely by rail in just one week, travelling through Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania and uncovering amazing stories and dark secrets from the region's past. He begins in Narva, Estonia, before heading to the capital Tallinn on the country's oldest railway, built by German nobles to connect the Russian imperial capital St Petersburg with Estonia's ports, then travelling through Latvia and Lithuania and heading to the Russian border on a revolutionary new line

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Time-conscious traveller Richard Ayoade is joined by actor Paul Rudd for a brisk romp round the Finnish capital. To get their bearings the pair head straight to the ladies toilet in the Torni hotel, which offers the best view of the city. They then go kayaking and snack on some reindeer jerky at the city's Hakaniemi market. Richard and Paul also visit not one, but two saunas - one of which can be found in a well-known burger chain. The duo also visit the wilderness island of Seurasaari, go foraging, and finish up in a sweet shop

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Writer, actor, comedian and podcaster Adam Buxton accompanies Richard Ayoade on a voyage of discovery in Lisbon, the Portuguese capital city known for its decorative tiling and maritime history. Adam and Richard tackle it at break-neck speed in an electric rickshaw, visit a tinned-fish emporium, take the celebrated iron lift - the Elevador de Santa Justa - and listen to some fado, Lisbon's version of the blues. There's potent cherry liqueur for breakfast, a tram ride up a steep hillside and a trip to a doll hospital. The duo also pay a visit to Belem, home to Lisbon's famed custard tarts

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo stops at Mattoon, Illinois, where he gets a taste of the early life that shaped President Abraham Lincoln, though struggles to split one rail compared with Lincoln's estimated 700 a day. The political pundit then heads to Kentucky, where a bloody conflict proved decisive in victory for Lincoln's Union. Aboard a paddle steamer on the lower Mississippi, Michael hears about the life of former river boat captain Samuel Clemens, better known as Mark Twain, and in Memphis, Tennessee, uncovers the story of a devastating epidemic. In the home of the Blues, Michael joins some Elvis fans at Graceland

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. Mia and Emmanuel from the Mayfield Hotel want to clean up Heather and Paul's cleanliness comments, before they find themselves under the microscope for the exact same reason. Hugh and Loretta are keen to throw back the covers on Sharon's sleep worries, before Sharon and her sister Deby reveal they didn't take too kindly to their digs being compared to a student flat

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&Bers spend a third consecutive visit in Cornwall, at ex-military man Jo's The Olde Malthouse in Tintagel, where a number of B&Bers are wowed by the heritage charm

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week takes the B&Bers to Sherborne in Dorset, and The Britannia Inn, run by husband-and-wife team Lee and Hannah. Doubts about the dcor get things off to a bad start for a handful of guests, while the controversial pricing at breakfast leaves Kirstie questioning whether she's getting enough bang for her buck

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. Kirstie and Joe from Cedarwood Holidays want to know why not all of their guests would return to their place, before Craig and Rachel ask why not a single B&Ber would choose to stay at theirs again. Jo from The Olde Malthouse is keen to mop up his cleanliness complaints, while Hannah and Lee from The Britannia Inn have a gripe with Jo in particular. They then learn the identity of the winner

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Mother and daughter Laura and Leah Wright from Surrey have been enjoying holidays together in Spain since Leah was a child. Laura has now decided to put the cash from a recent inheritance towards buying a holiday home on Spain's Orihuela Costa that they can enjoy throughout the year, so Scarlette Douglas shows them five properties for their budget of 65,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Newly married couple Ed and Clare are planning to start a family soon and will need a larger home. Ed wants to raise his family where he grew up in Lunigiana, Italy, so Jonnie Irwin finds some rural properties within their 250,000 budget. However, Clare wants to remain close to her relatives, so asks Laura Hamilton to find them suitable properties in the Sevenoaks area of Kent

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Ben Hillman meets Justine Noades and Ashley Pollak, who are so fond of Ibiza that they've visited the Greek party island eight times, and even got married there. Having put their night-clubbing days behind them, the pair now plan to start a family, and are seeking their dream holiday home, so Ben shows them five properties tailored to their budget of 270,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Retired couple Dabi and Devi can't wait to wave goodbye to the grey skies of Croydon and say hola to the sunshine and heat in the seaside town of Gandia in Valencia. They're looking for a second home where they can spend up to six months at a time. With a budget of 180,000, Lee Juggurnauth lines up five impressive options, but will any wow Dabi and Devi enough to make the move?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jean Johansson helps Georgina and Robert find a holiday home on the Caribbean island of St Lucia so they can visit Georgina's family. On a budget of 200,000 Jean shows them the best the island has to offer

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Danni Menzies helps Alison and Brian find their dream holiday home in Denia. The couple are looking for a flat or house with plenty of outdoor space on a budget of 160,000

programme.title: Five Star Kitchen: Britain's Next Great Chef
programme.desc: The contest in which up-and-coming chefs compete to prove that they have the culinary skills and business brain to win a once-in-a-lifetime prize - their own restaurant within London's exclusive Langham hotel - reaches its finale. The three remaining contenders must run the Palm Court as if it was already their own for one night and devise and deliver a menu representative of their concept. In the kitchen, Michel Roux Jr watches on with a scrutinising eye as the hopefuls try to prove they are capable of delivering five-star quality dining

programme.title: Bake Off: The Professionals
programme.desc: The five remaining teams throw their experience out the window when they make 24 identical re-imagined tarts. They must tap into their creative sides when asked to serve 24 peach melbas in never-before-seen ways. In the second challenge, the teams create a pice monte featuring 160 individual choux buns with a 'Mad Science' theme

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Staff at Queen's Medical Centre in Nottingham treat Kaeden, a 16-year-old battling a serious childhood illness, who has been rushed in after developing a fever at home. His mother describes her son's struggle with acute lymphoblastic leukaemia. Other patients include an aspiring pilot who has come off his motorbike during a track race and a man who has partially amputated his thumb

programme.title: Sky Coppers
programme.desc: Following the work of the West Midlands Police Drone Unit as they pursue suspects trying to hide up trees, discarding drugs and running away from the scene of a crime. As the team show up with a drug warrant, the suspected dealer tries to throw several wads of cash from an upstairs window - totally unaware he is being watched from above

programme.title: Murder in the Alps
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the 2012 murder of British computer engineer Saad Al-Hilli, his dentist wife Ikbal, and her mother Suhaila in the woods near Lake Annecy, a case that has gone unsolved for 10 years. Caught up in a media whirlwind, Saad's brother Zaid was eventually arrested under suspicion of conspiracy to murder and accused of organising the killings of his brother and family over an inheritance dispute, but was cleared and released. Telling the full story for the first time, Zaid is joined by former French prosecutor Eric Maillaud, retired British senior investigating officer Mark Preston, and journalist Tom Parry

programme.title: Murder in the Alps
programme.desc: The second episode sees Saad Al-Hilli's brother Zaid arrested on suspicion of conspiracy to murder, and follows leads that take investigators to Switzerland, Iraq and the USA. Detectives hunt for a motorcyclist with a distinctive helmet spotted near the crime scene, the FBI help to uncover a secret marriage, journalists dig into connections with the Iraqi regime, and police find a Swiss bank account containing almost a million euros

programme.title: Murder in the Alps
programme.desc: The conclusion of the crime documentary asks why so much attention was focused on prime suspect Zaid Al-Hilli, who was eventually released without charge. Former senior investigating police officer Mark Preston turns the case on its head with a surprising new theory, and other investigators examine whether the killer could still be found, almost a decade after the shootings

programme.title: Jamie's One-Pan Wonders
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver's favourite recipes from the series, including rolled pork belly, risotto and giant spicy meatballs, the easiest chicken pie and a stunning aubergine burger

programme.title: Supermarkets Unwrapped
programme.desc: The team head for the Vegan Aisle for all the news on animal-free food. Helen Lawal visits Tesco to find out how they keep up with all the plant-based burger trend, John Whaite seeks out the secret to the snap in a vegan sausage skin, Kate Quilton finds out how exactly you milk an oat, and Briony May Williams learns how to make a quiche without egg

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Vicki Fairbrother hosts the first party in East Lancashire, hoping her steak main and banoffee pie dessert will be enough to win her the 1,000 prize. However, she must contend with self-confessed snob Chelsea Symcox, perfectionist Chris Slater, entrepreneur Jenna Tattersall and hairdresser Nigel Womack if she is to walk away with the cash at the end of the week

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Businesswoman Jenna Tattersall hosts the second dinner party in East Lancashire, but an unimpressed Chelsea Symcox suspects the stuffed courgette starter is intended to send a message to the guests. Jenna's decision to hire a bouncy castle as post-meal entertainment also causes concern

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Chris Slater tries to add some class to proceedings as he hosts the third dinner party in East Lancashire, but his habit of chewing with his mouth open disgusts his guests. The spicy main course gives Jenna Tattersall acid reflux, and Nigel Womack has an embarrassing incident with a shortbread biscuit

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Chelsea Symcox hosts the fourth party in East Lancashire. While the boys fight over a punch-bag in the garage, the girls discover a secret about their host when they find her credit card. Chelsea hopes her Mediterranean menu is enough to win her the 1,000 prize at the end of the week

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hairdresser Nigel Womack hosts the final dinner party in East Lancashire, hoping his romantic evening will impress his guests. With a menu featuring aphrodisiacs, he aims to create an amorous mood among his diners, and also sings a song before the winner of the 1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: Near Le Havre, new chateau owners Chris and Jolyon have bought Chteau Trois Cloches. It's a huge project but, eager to turn it into a home and events venue, the pair start work on creating an opulent guest suite. Donna and Paul want to create a new conference space in their basement. It could be a big earner, but the project will flounder if they can't work out how to plumb in the subterranean toilet. Jayne and Steve host their very first wedding but, having just sold their chateau, it will also be the only wedding they will ever 'do'. Narrated by Adjoa Andoh

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Property experts meet fitness fanatics Mike Bennett and Andree Warbrick who cannot decide between buying a property on southern Spain's Costa Tropical or opting for a bigger house in the Cotswolds

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Property expert Sara Damergi helps Mark Shaw and Wlan Amorim from London search for their ideal holiday home in the historical centre of Valencia - one of Spain's biggest cities. The pair have a budget of 100,000 and chef Wlan is unable to compromise on the size of the kitchen

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: In Alicante, sisters Sophie and Charlotte Rodriguez catch up with former clients Marsha and Adrian from Glenrothes, who bought a home in the area in 2017. With their budget of 120,000 euros, and having both grown up by the Scottish seaside, this couple were looking to return to their coastal roots but with a sunnier climate. Five years on, Sophie and Charlotte are back to see how they have settled into the Spanish way of life. In Almera, husband-and-wife team Sharon and Steve Garner are reunited with Lincolnshire couple Arthur and Melanie, who back in 2021 had a budget of 295,000 euros and were looking to move lock, stock, and barrel, with their many worldly possessions and their two dogs

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: This competition comes from Blackpool and Preston, where the first host, 26-year-old student and barmaid Rachel, plans an American diner-themed menu. It's a menu that confuses her guests, but they all agrees that her hosting 'rocks'

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Lady of leisure Jill is second to host in and around Blackpool and Preston, leaving no stone unturned in her effort to impress her guests with an Italian-themed menu

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cabin crew member Mark throws the third dinner party of the week, hoping to impress his guests with an evening of fine dining and first class hosting

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Parole officer Bernard takes over hosting duties in Blackpool and Preston, hoping to woo his guests with a combination of northern soul and delicious grub. But a squabble over the starter results in a walk-out during the main course

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It's the final day in Blackpool and Preston and health assistant Lisa is banking on her 'no-faff' menu to bag the cash. However, it's not going to be easy, especially after the criticisms that have been free-flowing across the week. Home truths are revealed and temperatures soar, especially when Bernard gets the shock of his life as he's labelled boring, and he in turn tells Mark that he has been a drama queen. Lisa realises she needs to act quickly to change the atmosphere or risk losing out on the prize

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Danni Menzies goes house hunting around the attractive seaside town of Dnia on Spain's Costa Blanca with Alison and Brian. The couple have been dreaming of buying a holiday home for years and have a budget of 160,000 to find an apartment or house with plenty of outside space for them to relax in with their two dogs

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: George visits Manchester to bring an arts and crafts-inspired Edwardian home into the modern day. In London, he meets Flo, a first-time buyer whose flat needs a rejig to make it the sociable space she has always wanted

programme.title: Jamie's One-Pan Wonders
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver's favourite recipes from the series, including rolled pork belly, risotto and giant spicy meatballs, the easiest chicken pie and a stunning aubergine burger

programme.title: Rocketman (2019)
programme.desc: Elton John enters an addiction rehabilitation session, and recounts his life in a flashback, covering his days as young Reginald Dwight growing up in 1950s Britain. He takes piano lessons, makes his way into the Royal Academy of Music, and hones his craft in local pubs before becoming one of the world's biggest pop stars. Golden Globe-winning biopic, starring Taron Egerton, Jamie Bell and Richard Madden

programme.title: In the Footsteps of Killers
programme.desc: Emilia Fox and criminologist David Wilson investigate the disappearance of 13-year-old David Spencer and 11-year-old Patrick Warren, who went missing in Birmingham on Boxing Day in 1996. To this day, no one has been charged with the double disappearance and murder of the two friends, and their bodies have never been found despite two major police investigations and a missing persons campaign that featured the boys' pictures on milk cartons. But now, Emilia and David discover new evidence leading to a prime suspect

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: At Nottingham's Queen's Medical Centre, 87-year-old Joan is brought in after falling on a moving tram and cutting open the back of her head. Elsewhere, 19-year-old Rose faces life-changing injuries after being thrown into the air by a car, and 13-year-old Prince has broken his leg in three places playing football

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: First of a two-part special taking viewers behind the scenes of a Cambridgeshire police investigation into a woman who is plotting to have her ex-husband killed. A man handed police a secretly recorded conversation that appeared to show his girlfriend offering to pay someone to commit murder, and DS Mike Barnshaw has to work out whether the recording is evidence that she really wanted him dead or is pillow talk with a man she has picked up on a dating site

programme.title: Britain's Best Beach Huts
programme.desc: Jay Blades and Laura Jackson hunt for the most cutting-edge, 21st-century beach hut. Jay discovers the best view from a loo in Lincolnshire before heading to Eastbourne too visit a takeaway cafe within a pair of beach hut binoculars made to move with the sun. Laura tours an eco-friendly beach hut in Wales where recycling is taken to the max and possibly the country's toughest huts that double up as a seawall to hold back the tide in Hampshire

programme.title: Extraordinary Escapes with Sandi Toksvig
programme.desc: Sandi and comedian, actor and writer Roisin Conaty explore Wales from the Pembrokeshire Coast to the English border staying in the best retreats the country has to offer. Starting with Seren Mor near the Nevern Estuary, Roisin is blown away by the contemporary architecture and dogs on the beach. Electric bikes take the pair over to Powys where they stay at the Hergest Lee Cabin and Lean-To, styled with quirky design and mid-century furnishings. Finally, the pair top off their escape in Moor Tower, a refurbished folly by Hay on Wye just a mile from the Welsh boarder boasting views of the Black Mountains, The Brecon Beacons and the Wye Valley

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Theatre-lover Claire Flatt hosts the first party in Ipswich, where one guest makes a big impression by arriving in a limousine. Claire prepares Thai fishcakes and Princess Jasmine rice, as well as her signature dish 'chaos cake', in the hope of winning the 1,000 prize at the end of the week

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Millwall fan Kerrie Pankhurst hosts the second dinner party in Ipswich, which she decides to give a football theme - but the mood turns sour when one of the guests insults her team. Kerrie's decision to serve scallops and chorizo as her starter also does not go down well with DJ Dave James

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Magician David J Marks hosts the third dinner party in Ipswich, and hopes to win over Kerrie Pankhurst after offending her the previous night. His salmon starter impresses all the diners except Dave James, who explains all the gruesome things he would rather do than eat the fish, so the host lightens the mood by showing off his ventriloquist dummies and laying on a magic show

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: DJ Dave James hosts the fourth dinner party from Ipswich and asks his guests to attend dressed as pop stars. Claire Flatt and Nicki Yucel are suspicious about his celebrity connections, and there is trouble when the diners discover Dave obtained help with the cooking

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Speed-dating expert Nicki Yucel hosts the final dinner party in Ipswich, and is determined to cultivate a romantic atmosphere. As the evening progresses, Kerrie Pankhurst reveals her feelings for another diner, before the winner of the 1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: Phillip gets creative upcycling 1950s style furniture, while at Chteau de la Fare, Janet and Phillip put all their energy into finishing their large Empire Suite

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman and Sara Damergi help best friends Mary-Rose Cross and Jane Murison make a big decision. They want to have an adventure and move either to Oban in Scotland or Lake Vinuela in Andalucia, southern Spain

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi helps teachers Paul Gardner and Paula McKee hunt for the perfect property near Murcia, Spain, after the soon-to-be-wed pair both secured jobs at the nearby international school. The couple have set aside a budget of 200,000 for the relocation

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: In Alicante, Charlotte Rodriguez is on a quest to find a home in the sun for a keen baker from Nottingham looking for a place big enough to accommodate him and his grandchildren

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Carpenter Wes Leaver hosts the first party in east Kent, hoping his science theme will be enough to win him the 1,000 prize at the end of the week. However, the 34-year-old faces competition from estate agent Alexandra Austin, beautician Emma Phillips, dog-lover Sally Parry and fancy-dress enthusiast Stephen Drew

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Estate agent Alexandra Austen hosts the second party of the week in east Kent, hoping to impress her guests with pan-European cuisine. However, the meal gets off to a shaky start when Sally Parry is forced to confront her fear of beans, while Stephen Drew struggles with a goat's cheese parcel. Alexandra's decision to serve veal also proves controversial, and it soon becomes clear two of the guests are not enjoying each other's company

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Beautician Emma Phillips hosts the third dinner party in east Kent. Her main course is described by one diner as a pet on a plate, and Alexandra Austin declares the menu to be rather odd. Meanwhile, Stephen Drew and Wes Leaver enjoy an impromptu beauty treatment together

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dog-lover Sally Parry hosts the fourth dinner party in east Kent, hoping to impress her guests with a pink-themed night, including posh pink food and table decorations. However, Sally and Emma have a heated argument, Alex misbehaves and Wes falls asleep

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Flamboyant Stephen Drew hosts the final dinner party in east Kent, and has designed a menu that will allow him to spend time entertaining his guests. With an Absolutely Fabulous theme, a few of the diners are expecting a Mardi Gras vibe, but he has different ideas for the night - before the winner of the 1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Yvonne and Graham want a holiday bolthole in the Algarve, as close as possible to the harbour and beach, so Ben Hillman lines up five contenders for their budget of 135,000

programme.title: Britain's Best Beach Huts
programme.desc: Jay Blades and Laura Jackson hunt for the most cutting-edge, 21st-century beach hut. Jay discovers the best view from a loo in Lincolnshire before heading to Eastbourne too visit a takeaway cafe within a pair of beach hut binoculars made to move with the sun. Laura tours an eco-friendly beach hut in Wales where recycling is taken to the max and possibly the country's toughest huts that double up as a seawall to hold back the tide in Hampshire

programme.title: Exploring India's Treasures with Bettany Hughes
programme.desc: Part two of two. Bettany travels to Thanjavur, also known at Tanjore, which was once the capital of the Chola empire, one of the longest ruling dynasties in world history. She explores the 10th-century Brihadeeswarar Temple, before taking the Nilgiri Mountain Railway, an outstanding example of an innovative transportation system built through uneven and challenging terrain. Bettany's adventure in the Malabar Coast finishes aboard one of Kerala's famous houseboats

programme.title: Britain's Most Expensive Houses
programme.desc: Sales broker John has a vast family home to sell in the stunning New Forest. Surrounded by a national park and with 26 acres of grounds, including a swimming pool, an orchard and private woodland, this 12-bedroom home built in 1897 has an asking price of 9million. Meanwhile, managing director Guy and Aoife work on one of their smallest properties - an industrial-style one-bedroom pied--terre in Pimlico in central London, which belongs to the chief executive of Brighton Football Club

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: A rolling cast of famous faces, some of Britain's best loved personalities, turn their hand to being the country's most opinionated viewers, sharing their opinions on what they have been watching during the week. Among those talking up sofa space are Rylan and his mother Linda, Guz Khan and Jamali Maddix, Martin and Roman Kemp, Deborah Meaden and Peter Jones, Judi Love and Charlene White, Zoe Ball, Johnny Ball and Woody Cook, Katherine Ryan and her husband Bobby, Miquita and Andi Oliver, Fearne Cotton and Gok Wan, Nick Grimshaw and his niece Liv, and Shaun Ryder and Bez

programme.title: Sky Coppers
programme.desc: The hunt is on for a man who has assaulted an officer and dragged them along with his car before escaping. Sergeant Keith Bennet and PC Chris Turton search for a motorbike thief hiding in a wood in the dead of night. After reports come in of a man loitering in gardens in Birmingham, the team find out not everything is as it seems

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: In the conclusion of this two-part documentary, Victoria Breeden is taken into custody, but claims she is not fit to be interviewed, while police search her home for evidence that proves she has attempted to hire someone to murder her husband. Detectives are determined not to have to release her, but DC Louisa Abbott fears she is dealing with the cleverest criminal she has ever encountered

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: George visits Manchester to bring an arts and crafts-inspired Edwardian home into the modern day. In London, he meets Flo, a first-time buyer whose flat needs a rejig to make it the sociable space she has always wanted

programme.title: Becoming Elizabeth
programme.desc: Drama following the untold story of Elizabeth I, before she ascended the throne. Henry VIII's death throws a young orphan Elizabeth Tudor into the unpredictable and dangerous English court. As her nine-year-old brother is crowned king and the great families of England and powers of Europe vie for control of the country, she and her siblings become pawns in a dangerous game

programme.title: Jamie's One-Pan Wonders
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver's favourite recipes from the series, including rolled pork belly, risotto and giant spicy meatballs, the easiest chicken pie and a stunning aubergine burger

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: PC Craig Dawes attends a fatal collision involving a motorcycle and car, where he and Sgt Matt Edwards secure the site for crash investigators, who try to piece together what happened. Sgt Scott Riley spots and follows a biker he thinks looks suspicious, with a computer check indicating the bike is not licensed or insured

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Around 11,000 automatic number plate recognition cameras continually monitor vehicles on Britain's roads. With ANPR readers installed in their patrol cars, it is a valuable tool for Derbyshire's traffic cops, helping them track down dangerous offenders and illegal cars, vans and lorries. Karl Jackson is alerted to a possible disqualified driver when a passing car triggers his ANPR system, but the vehicle fails to stop and a pursuit begins

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: Watford builder David Simpson has a fight on his hands when his long-term tenant moves her boyfriend in and suddenly decides to stop paying - and when he tries to evict her, she makes life difficult. In Woolwich, lawyer Chris Sharpe helps a client whose property has been taken over by squatters, who have changed the locks and claim they are legitimately renting the house

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: The owner of a tanning salon regrets letting an employee move into a house he owns when he is faced with complaints from the neighbours about wild parties and 3,000 in unpaid rent. A couple managing a property for their daughter arrange to sell it, only to find the tenant refuses to leave, while a housing enforcement officer goes in search of a landlord who has left a tenant without light, heat or running water

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: Teorin and Collette had high hopes when they let out their five-bedroom family home, but it wasn't long before their tenant stopped paying rent - and then turned the house into a hostel for holiday-makers. Quickly running out of options, the couple turn to eviction specialist Chris Sharpe for help. Plus, Harrow council officers discover 40 people crammed into a potential deathtrap of a house, and a woman who relies on her rent for medical expenses tries to claw back some from her tenant

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: An east London landlord who trusted his property to a letting agency discovers the house is being advertised on a Romanian website - and strangers have moved in. A South Yorkshire single mum is owed 10,000 in back rent when her tenant disappears, and has to prove he has abandoned the property to get it back. Plus, west London housing officers investigate a tip-off about people living in dangerous conditions behind a row of shops

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: Susan and Gary bought an East End flat to let out and were approached by a letting agent who promised hassle-free guaranteed rent. But before they knew it, he had broken in and changed the locks. Now they are fighting to get the property back. Meanwhile, landlord Paul discovers that his seriously ill father's long-standing tenant owes a staggering 20,000 in rent for living in her Notting Hill home

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: PC Andy Swift is on the lookout for a high-value car stolen from a dealership after being taken for a test drive, while he also searches for builder's van taken from a driveway while the owner popped briefly inside to collect his tools and equipment. PC Dave Shaw is patrolling on a night shift when he follows a car suspected of being used in house burglary

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: PC Tom Strachan gives pursuit when a car is spotted by police cameras being driven with no insurance, but when records flag up the suspect has a history of violence, an armed response team is called in too. The suspect throws a knife out of the car and then waves a baseball bat out of his window, banging it on the roof and making offensive hand gestures at the police behind him

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: A gang of burglars breaks into a house and takes the keys to luxury cars. After the thieves flee in three stolen vehicles, multiple teams hunt them down with the police chopper. The first burglar is caught after a lengthy pursuit of a stolen Mercedes, which he abandons before running straight into the path of waiting officers. Once the occupants of a second stolen Merc are apprehended by the chopper team, Ben and Warren go after the third vehicle - which they are stunned to witness burst into flames

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Dog handler Duncan and the firearms team find themselves in a tense stand-off with suspected drug dealers who could be armed, with German shepherd Tia sent in to search and discovering more than the unit bargained for. Steve has to deal with two teens, one who has crashed a stolen car, and the other who has been involved in a bar brawl, while Kev is poised to take out a car with a stinger

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Officers go in pursuit of a driver who is so drunk that he can't even keep his car on the road and the chase ends with shocking results. Elsewhere, dog handler Tony encounters a naked man stranded at the side of the road, and Sophie is forced to buy a treat for the entire team due to a rookie mistake

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: The firearms team mobilises to tackle a suspect armed with a pistol, and hours into a nerve-shredding siege, the man emerges with a handgun and fires. Elsewhere, interceptors Rob and Dan join in the pursuit of a runaway hatchback, while the members of the knife crime team track down a suspect on a bike trying to evade capture in a park

programme.title: Elysium (2013)
programme.desc: In the future, most of the human race exists in poverty on a ruined Earth, while a wealthy elite live in luxury on an orbiting space station. A man dying of radiation poisoning fights security forces to gain access to the satellite and its medical facilities. Sci-fi thriller from the director of District 9, starring Matt Damon, Jodie Foster and Sharlto Copley

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: Drag artist Wayne and his husband cook meals to give to the local homeless community, and also begin work on their next charitable project, refurbishing a womens' refuge centre

programme.title: Call the Bailiffs: Time to Pay Up
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of enforcement agents as they execute High Court writs on behalf of people desperate to recover money they are owed. programme.desc: Kent couple Rachel and Chris are pushed to the limit when their relationship with their tenant breaks down and she stops paying rent, leaving them more than 5,000 out of pocket. Now they need to get her out or they could lose the house. Elsewhere, a tenant uses scare tactics to keep his landlord off his back, and in Harrow, council housing officers investigate a residential property that has been turned into a brothel

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston returns with a focus on officers on patrol in North Yorkshire, beginning as they clamp down on young drivers causing danger on the county's roads. On the outskirts of York, officers suspect drugs are involved when a young, speeding driver collides with a lorry, while police are forced to use a stinger and puncture three tyres to stop a repeat drunk and drugged driver near Selby

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Officers in York are forced into one of their most dangerous pursuits after a report of a stolen car travelling at recklessly high speeds towards the city centre. A lone cop in the Dales at night urgently needs back-up to prevent a dangerous speeding drunk who is determined to flee, while police receive a tip-off claiming a man drove home from a pub drunk after refusing to pay his bill

programme.title: Police Interceptors

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: A police chase ends with the driver of a stolen Lexus crashing the luxury motor, and the police interception unit deals with an Essex girl whose car is too sexy for the law. Elsewhere, a high-speed pursuit results in a head-on collision with one of the team's vehicles

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: The team discovers the garage hideout of a gang of burglars in a country lane, and pursues a BMW driver who endangers his life by running across four lanes of a dual carriageway to escape with a suspicious package. The police interceptors also apprehend a mother driving with no tax, insurance or MOT, who turns out never to have passed her driving test

programme.title: Dogs Behaving (Very) Badly
programme.desc: Graeme Hall meets a pair of troublesome Newfoundlands who are scaring Dawn and Gordon's family away from their home before they even make it over the doorstep. Elsewhere, he heads to the Lake District to meet John and Linda, who are worried that their dog Harris' love of the water may end up getting him into trouble

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Unaware that Andrew's 'mother' is an imposter, Justin is confident that he and Leah did the right thing letting him go. Cash is determined to right an error

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Cash and Justin have reached a dead end in the search for Margot and Andrew. Marilyn remains shaken after the continued threats against her

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: Dr Amanda Ramshaw tries to get to the bottom of Diego's crippling headaches, and later she offers reassurance to a patient who is worried about developing Lyme disease after an encounter with a tick. Elsewhere, Dr Amir Khan is impressed with the attitude of a patient who has suffered with a chronic bladder condition all her life

programme.title: Casualty 24/7: Every Second Counts
programme.desc: Every bed in the department is occupied, but there are still 20 patients waiting for the next one to be vacated. Lead Nurse Steph is already struggling to manage the mounting number of patients when the emergency alarm sounds and all available staff must head to resus to help a fitting patient

programme.title: Skin A&E
programme.desc: The specialist clinic opens its doors to patients with acne, psoriasis and cysts.

programme.title: Shoplifters & Scammers: At War with the Law
programme.desc: An entertainer who uses his pickpocketing skills on stage shows why everyone should be aware when taking money from an ATM

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: Eviction expert Paul Shamplina helps Londoner Juliette get her property back after she signed up with an estate agent who sub-contracted it on to another company, which handed the contract on to yet another letting agent

programme.title: 999: Critical Condition
programme.desc: Damion has sustained numerous traumatic injuries after being trapped upside down in his car following a crash. Despite numerous injuries to the head and chest, Trauma Team Leader Dr Chris Pickering is most worried about Damion's lungs as his patient struggles to breathe

programme.title: The Sex Business
programme.desc: Documentary taking a look at how people buy, sell and market sex. A disparate group of relatively new recruits to Britain's flourishing and fast-growing porn industry reveals what life is really like when trying to make a living in the adult movie industry

programme.desc: The tale of an elderly couple whose hopes of a peaceful retirement were ruined when their tenants stopped paying rent, then moved in their abusive friends who became squatters. With the house becoming a free-for-all and in a terrible state of repair, and the couple facing a barrage of verbal threats and abusive behaviour, they have been forced to seek help in an attempt to get their property back. Plus, a man who cannot sell his house because his sitting tenant refuses to leave

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: A prolific car thief with a string of convictions under his belt crashes and rolls a stolen car at over 100mph, while in Harrogate the hunt for a cloned car and disqualified driver leads to a high-speed pursuit. The suspect leaps from the moving car and leaves it driverless, heading downhill straight towards a busy main road during the rush hour

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: With no ambulances available, officers and an off-duty nurse try to help a young motorcyclist in a serious condition after colliding with a parked truck. A young and desperate driver flees from the police at over 100mph and is left trapped upside down in a smoking car after crashing out of control and rolling his car, while a joyrider takes his mum's car out for a spin wearing just his pyjamas, before losing control and overturning

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Officers follow a stolen BMW fitted with a tracking device as it heads for a cargo ship, while a drunk driver is pursued through Epping Forest. Documentary series profiling the work of a high-speed police interception unit in Essex

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Specially trained officers try to stop a 4x4 as it is driven dangerously through the streets of Basildon, and pursue a fake ambulance. In the air above Essex, the police helicopter trails a pair of teenage car thieves

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: The team tracks three men suspected of burgling a number of plumbers' merchants, and a fleeing van causes a major accident by speeding the wrong way around a busy roundabout. Police also investigate illegally customised vehicles in Basildon, Essex, and a man threatens to battle through a street full of officers

programme.desc: After their beloved boxer Beau passed away, Liane got another dog of the same breed, Woody, to mend her son's broken heart. But her plan to fix things has spectacularly backfired - 11-year-old Ben feels bullied by Woody and can't even have his mates over for a kickabout without the dog causing chaos. Can Graeme Hall save the day and reunite a family?

Now they just need a chef to run it and they try out David, who has been working in pest control since he lost his chef's job in the pandemic. Colin and Justin are also renovating the reception area and want to make it more welcoming with a gift shop, so they visit a local sawmill to find timber shelves made from wood from the surrounding forest

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: The crumpled detective applies his well-honed instincts to a case of blackmail and murder in the world of haute cuisine when a restaurant owner is found dead after throwing a renowned food critic off his premises. Crime drama from The Silence of the Lambs director Jonathan Demme, starring Peter Falk, Louis Jourdan, Shera Danese and Richard Dysart

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A maker of motivational films based on subliminal messages uses his expertise to plant a subconscious command in the mind of a rival to lure him to his death. However, any hopes of his getting away with it are dashed by the arrival of a certain shabby sleuth. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Robert Culp, Robert Middleton, Louise Latham and Arlene Martel

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: An author of mystery novels kills his former writing partner so he can claim sole credit for their collaborations, and tries to appear innocent by offering to help Columbo solve the crime. Detective drama, directed by Steven Spielberg, starring Peter Falk, Jack Cassidy, Rosemary Forsyth and Barbara Colby

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A cosmetics company is rocked by the revelation that a pirated version of their latest product is on the market, and then, shortly afterwards, one of their chemists is found murdered. But when the shabby sleuth scrutinises the case, he suspects the events are linked to a rival company. Detective drama, starring Peter Falk, Vincent Price, Martin Sheen and Vera Miles

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A crooked lawyer hopes to start a promising political career, but a former client he saved from prison threatens to blow the whistle on him. The attorney murders the blackmailer and makes it look like suicide - but the shabby sleuth sees through his ruse and sets out to expose the truth. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Louis Zorich and Patrick McGoohan, who also directed

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: An ambitious Hollywood director is visited by an old friend, who threatens to expose evidence of his involvement in the death of an actor. The film-maker resorts to murder to keep his dark secret safe, only to end up on the receiving end of Columbo's distinctive brand of interrogation. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Fisher Stevens and Molly Hagan

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: Oscar-winning composer Findlay Crawford relies on his assistant Gabriel to do all the hard work, but the younger musician demands recognition. To protect his reputation, Findlay kills Gabriel with a time-delayed drug to give himself the perfect alibi - but the slovenly sleuth sees through his ruse. Detective drama, with Peter Falk and Billy Connolly

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs is forced to take a step back from work when his increasingly frail father Jackson begs him to help track down an old friend from the Second World War who does not have long left to live. Meanwhile, the rest of the team investigate the death of a marine sergeant who appears to have been caught in the crossfire during a bungled robbery, but Tony and Tim find evidence the victim may have been targeted. Crime drama, guest starring Ralph Waite (The Waltons), with Mark Harmon

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Racial tensions begin to boil over after an unarmed black man is shot by police from another precinct, and three officers are put on trial

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The SVU team is called to investigate when a famous violinist staying at a four-star hotel reports being raped by her colleague. However, on pursuing the accusation, the man in question claims to have no memory of the incident, but reveals he was recently drugged and robbed by a hired escort girl. Meanwhile, Rollins' mother Beth throws her a baby shower, and the event co-incides with the re-emergence of the detective's fugitive sister Kim. Crime drama, guest starring Virginia Madsen and Lindsay Pulsipher

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the cause of a hit-and-run incident in which a Petty Officer has been killed. Meanwhile, Gibbs works to clear a Navy Hospital Corpsman who has been indicted for illegally providing medical aid to victims of the crash, despite the injured insisting her techniques helped save their lives. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An enigmatic killer shoots dead a businessman spending Thanksgiving at a hotel in the city, then takes his glasses, jewellery and ID to Washington Dulles airport, which has been brought to a stand-still by a massive snowstorm. As the murderer's actions take effect, a terror alert is issued, leaving all northern US airports in a state of panic, and leaving it up to DiNozzo, Bishop and her husband - all of whom are trapped at Dulles by the weather - to bring the armed villain to justice. Crime drama, starring Michael Weatherley

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: McGee deals with his father's recent death by writing him a letter outlining the details of his latest investigation. The case involved tracking down a hactivist collective known as Krampus, who were thought to have been responsible for an incident in which the internet crashed all over Washington, DC. McGee and Abby brought in three known cyber-terrorists for questioning, and discover evidence that links the trio to an attempted breach of the Congress e-mail server and archive. However, when this line of inquiry reaches a dead-end, the team picks up a new lead that suggests an isolated hacker from Wisconsin may be responsible. This 'lone wolf' scenario does not seem plausible to McGee, though, as he recalls a lesson his late father taught him. Crime drama, starring Sean Murray

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The bodies of five people, all of whom are identified as being from the US Navy, are found on the floor of a diner, and all are connected to a suspicious tax firm that specialises in helping people who are in arrears. When further killings are linked to the business, the team realises the crime seem to be copycats of previous cases. Meanwhile, two of Gibbs' ex-wives appear at the location with something important to discuss with the agent. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: Law & Order

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A separated couple blame each other for concealing their missing baby, but the discovery of bloodstains in their apartment suggests another, more tragic explanation. An angry Briscoe suspects the father of murder - until the infant's remains are found, raising the possibility that both parents could be responsible

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the murder of a violinist with the New York Symphony Orchestra and find the trail leads back to her Svengali-like conductor. However, they have a difficult job getting the case to trial, with a reluctant witness, a suspicious judge and a talented lawyer standing between them and a guilty verdict

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A gang leader is stabbed to death in a prison scuffle, and Briscoe and Green uncover a number of suspects as it becomes clear the victim had numerous enemies on both sides of the law. The investigation results in a charge, but McCoy faces an uphill battle to convict the accused. Drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the murder of a clothes shop owner during an apparent robbery. An open lock suggests someone who works there was responsible, and the trail eventually leads to the son of the dead man's business partner, whose shady dealings were at risk of being exposed. However, the suspect flees to Israel before police have a chance to question him

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: As the NCIS team searches for Gibbs after wreckage from his boat is discovered, they find out he was tracking a serial killer with journalist Marcie Warren

programme.title: NCIS

programme.title: NCIS

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Parker is framed for murder, and the rest of the team put their jobs and lives on the line to buy time and uncover the truth

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The Bakers, the stars of America's top reality TV show, are rocked by scandal when 13-year-old daughter Lane is discovered to be three months pregnant. Ultra-conservative parents Pam and Frank resist SVU involvement in a misguided attempt to shield their 10 children - and their lucrative TV empire - from disgrace. However, when Lane accuses one of the show's cameramen of raping her, one who happens to have already had a vasectomy, it becomes clear the Bakers are trying to protect someone. Unable to aid in the inquiry due to her own pregnancy, Rollins decides to make good use of her time away from the beat to binge-watch the Bakers' show in an effort to identify potential suspects. Crime drama, starring Mariska Hartigay

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The hunt for a missing teenage girl takes an emotional toll on Sgt Dodds, and DNA evidence becomes the crucial link the team needs to identify the youngster's abductor. Hard-hitting and emotional series chronicling the life and crimes of the New York Police Department, starring Mariska Hargitay

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: American social worker Sarah Goode is taken hostage by militants in northern Syria, and thanks to the efforts of the Navy Seals, is eventually returned home unharmed. Evidence from the incident suggests US citizen Kyle Nasry was connected to the kidnapping, but when the agents trace Nasry to a rally held by a controversial imam, they are surprised to find Sarah among the attendees. Meanwhile, DiNozzo finally takes his relationship with Zoe Keates public - surprising none of his colleagues. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and his colleagues investigate when Eric Kutzler, the first openly gay Navy lieutenant tipped to receive the Medal of Honour, is murdered. While the agents initially suspect Kutzler's death was the result of a hate crime, the fact that his police officer husband waited 20 minutes to report the crime suggests he had something to hide. Meanwhile, the team throws a baby shower for Palmer as his wife's due date approaches. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: DiNozzo investigates a murder at the military academy he once attended, after a murdered marine and alumni of the school is found clutching a photo of a current student. Meanwhile, Bishop and her husband invite the team out for a special dinner. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team suspects Gibbs's arch-nemesis is behind an explosion at a summit on global terror. Meanwhile, a grief-stricken Fornell struggles to deal with the fatal shooting of his ex-wife. American drama, starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Pauley Perrette and Joe Spano

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Part one of two. Best-selling mystery writer PK Todd and her accountant are gunned down outside a restaurant. Miraculously, Todd survives but her companion is mortally wounded, prompting Briscoe and Green to launch a murder inquiry and discover the culprit's real target. However, they soon find themselves mixed up in a deadly case of jealousy and betrayal. Guest starring Ruthie Henshall and Tom Berenger

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The seemingly straightforward murder of a stockbroker plunges Briscoe and Green into the murky world of insider-trading and blackmail, as they learn that the victim led a seedy double life. However, their investigations take on a new dimension when the suspected killer is himself bumped off by a professional hitman. Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin star

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The murder of a white teenager in Harlem seems like an open-and-shut case - until two patrol officers are implicated in the crime. As tensions between residents and investigating officers mount, the Mayor puts pressure on Schiff to make an example of the cops, hoping it will be enough to satisfy ADA McCoy. Drama, starring Steven Hill

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Van Buren orders Briscoe and Green to reinvestigate unsolved cases, starting with the murder of a teenager 20 years previously. However, they discover much of the evidence gathered at the time has vanished, and the detective in charge of the case may have pursued an innocent man to protect the real culprit. An unexpected confession allows the case to end up in court again, but legal trickery makes a conviction an unlikely prospect

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A man with a history of violence is arrested for the murder of his son's school ice-hockey coach, but pleads mitigating circumstances. Helped by a glib defence lawyer, he claims that he committed the crime while suffering from a previously unknown mental condition he calls 'sports rage'

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the discovery of four bodies in a jeweller's shop. Suspicion soon falls on the husband of one of the victims, who is revealed to have changed his identity to escape a shady past. The shop's security tapes are subsequently discovered in his flat, but the defendant surprises everyone by insisting on representing himself in court - and makes a big impression on the jury

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and McGee head to Alaska while the rest of the team works at home to uncover the conspiracy behind the serial killer

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a Navy commander whose body suddenly explodes before Jimmy can examine it

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The officers investigate the death of a beloved commander who trained some of the top athletes in the country. Mark Harmon stars

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: The team is faced with a lengthy list of potential suspects while investigating the murder of a magazine editor whose abrasive personality won him many enemies as well as friends. The case takes a turn for the worse when one of the victim's colleagues is also killed, but the detectives are able to link his death to the Russian mafia. Crime drama, starring Jeff Goldblum and Leslie Hendrix

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson hopes justice will be served as child abductor Lewis Hodda goes on trial. However, when a plea deal is rejected, Barba must rely on decades-old evidence to make his case, and faces off against former SVU colleague Dr Huang. Crime drama, guest starring Tom Sizemore

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A high-school student succumbs to the flirtations of an attractive female teacher, and begins to plan a clandestine encounter. However, he quickly finds himself in a far more terrifying situation. Crime drama, starring Mariska Hargitay

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A covert identity created for one of Gibbs' undercover cases 20 years previously resurfaces after a murder victim is found to be using the alias. Meanwhile, Bishop becomes anxious at the thought of having to work incognito in the future. Starring Mark Harmon and Emily Wickersham

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A US Navy lieutenant is murdered at the Defence Logistics Agency, while visitings the office of an admiral currently away at sea. As the team investigates the scene of the crime, they realise a rare painting found in the admiral's office is actually an elaborate fake placed there after the killing, replacing the stolen original. As the quest to locate the missing artwork gets under way, the agents realise they need the help of an expert. Luckily, Tony's con-artist father has returned to town, having broken up with his fiancee, and is on hand to provide expert advice as the hunt for the killer takes them into the shady world of the black market. Guest starring Robert Wagner

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A woman is murdered at the home of Gunnery Sergeant Holt Perkins, and while the victim is initially assumed to be the marine's wife, analysis reveals her to be a convicted thief, presumed to be on the scene as part of a plot to hit Perkins' house. When the agents discover the calling card of notorious terror cell Dragon's Tooth on the body, it becomes clear the murder has been committed as part of a wider agenda, and the team joins forces with the Department of Defence to catch the killer. American drama, starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Cote de Pablo and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A prostitute and what seems to be one of her clients are gunned down in a drive-by shooting, and when it emerges that the would-be John was actually a Navy officer, Gibbs and DiNozzo realise the killings are connected Lex Tarlionas, an incomplete operation to bring justice to those responsible for an attack on a US airport in 1979, which left 100 people dead. The main suspect is a former Colombian drugs kingpin known as Tomas Orlando, and the murdered sex worker was about to hand over crucial DNA evidence that could have connected him to the crime, but now that she is dead, Gibbs and the others must find another way to finally bring Orlando in. American drama, starring Mark Harmon and David McCallum

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Met Police helicopter India 99 is called to help rescue a woman who jumped into the Thames near the Palace of Westminster, as well as her two daughters, who leapt in after her. Elsewhere, the helicopter team coordinates a risky game of cat-and-mouse as police chase a group of graffiti artists across live train tracks in a patch of industrial wasteland in Battersea. The episode also looks at the case of the Hounslow Slasher, a man who in 2012 randomly attacked lone women while they were travelling home at night. Nick Wallis presents

programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin shows Southampton couple David and Sonia five fantastic properties for their budget of 100,000 in the Almeria province of southern Spain

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: George and Lennox want to buy a dream holiday home in Almeria. With a budget of 150,000, Jonnie Irwin shows them around five beautiful properties.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Radio broadcaster Toby Anstis loves Ibiza and having enjoyed many holidays there for 20 years now wants to buy his own bolthole. With help from his twin sister Kate, and with a budget of 250,000, he asks Laura Hamilton to show him the best property the island has to offer

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Scarlette Douglas helps Martyn and Anne Golesworthy find a holiday home on the Greek island of Naxos, which holds a special place in their hearts as the place they got married

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Alex Polizzi heads to Cornwall to help Sean and Janine, the owners of Northshore, Bude's only hostel. Having returned from travelling the world, the pair bought the property to keep their travelling dream alive. Running the hostel is the best job Sean's ever had - but a shocking downturn in occupancy and their unorthodox living scenario have left Janine wanting out. Desperate to sort the business, the couple call on Alex's advice in a last-ditch attempt to resolve matters. The expert arrives with a few surprises up her sleeve, but quickly learns saving this business isn't going to be easy

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: The treasure-hunting challenge returns with a husband-and-wife battle as Downton Abbey star Phyllis Logan takes on Kevin McNally, who has featured in all four Pirates of the Caribbean movies. Travelling in classic cars and accompanied by antiques experts, the couple head through Kent towards an auction in Greenwich, south-east London. En route Phyllis visits the impressive collection of a controversial conservationist, while Kevin reveals just how much he knows about the universe

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: The antiques-hunting challenge sees Midsomer Murders star Neil Dudgeon take on his friend and veteran actress Diana Rigg in the battle for glory. Travelling in classic cars and accompanied by experts Catherine Southon and Paul Laidlaw, the duo uncover the gems to be found on their home turf of Yorkshire. Neil finds he is something of a natural when it comes to antiques, while Diana is quick to show her expert that she is in the driver's seat

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong

The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong

programme.title: Border Patrol
programme.desc: Follow the work of the New Zealand Customs agents in their quest to prevent illegal items passing through the country's borders.

programme.title: Border Security: America's Front Line
programme.desc: Reality series charting the work of US Customs and Border Protection agents, responsible for acting as the first line of defence for air, sea and land entry-points to the US

programme.title: Nothing to Declare
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary accessing the world of national security at Australia's biggest airports as customs and immigration officers tackle drug runners, illegal immigrants and terrorists

programme.title: Warehouse 13
programme.desc: Artie instructs Myka and Pete to investigate several suspicious suicides in a Florida prison. Sci-fi drama, starring Eddie McClintock and Joanne Kelly

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Four of the Enterprise's junior officers wait to hear whether they've won promotion, and one of them, a Bajoran, finds herself sent on a perilous mission into Cardassian space. Sci-fi drama, starring Patrick Stewart

programme.title: Merlin
programme.desc: Knight Valiant arrives in Camelot to compete in the annual sword-fighting tournament and faces Arthur in the final. Merlin realises the combatant has a ruse to beat his opponents that could spell death for the prince - but struggles to convince King Uther of his findings. Will Mellor guest stars

programme.title: Star Trek: Voyager
programme.desc: Seven's past returns with a vengeance as she is bombarded with flashbacks of her existence as a Borg following the arrival on Voyager of drones from her original group. Sci-fi adventure, starring Kate Mulgrew and Jeri Ryan

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Navy lieutenant Max Landry asks the field office for help when he suspects his girlfriend is a spy, while LaSalle faces another dead end as he searches for his brother

programme.title: Caught on Dashcam
programme.desc: A countdown of the most incredible, hilarious and spectacular real-life crashes in the world - all caught on dashcam

programme.title: Grimm
programme.desc: Following a brutal attack in the woods, Nick and Hank stumble upon a terrifying Wesen disease that may be the inspiration for the modern-day werewolf myth. Meanwhile, Adalind is offered an uneasy alliance that may help her get back what she wants most and Eve's investigation uncovers a surprising revelation. Ann Cusack guest stars

programme.title: Snapped
programme.desc: When a young father in Texas vanishes without a trace and is later found murdered, mobile phone records and internet history reveal a cunning killer.

programme.title: Killer in My Village
programme.desc: The tragic story of 72-year-old Jane Hings, who was raped and killed in her home in Leicestershire by 25-year-old Craig Keogh

programme.title: For Life
programme.desc: Aaron is in trouble as Cassius begins to suspect he is a snitch and seeks revenge, while Foster struggles to lay low during his last two weeks at work

programme.title: UK Border Force
programme.desc: Officers at Heathrow's Terminal 3 question a passenger from Johannesburg arriving in London on a tourist visa, suspecting he may be planning to work in the country. Entry Clearance Officer Dan Brown, on secondment to the British High Commission in Delhi, encounters a man carrying false identity documents
