programme.title: London's Weekend
programme.desc: A chance to catch up on the week's headlines and a taste of what to see and do in London this weekend.

programme.title: Two Men in a Boat Chasing Spring
programme.desc: Jeremy Norman and his partner Derek Frost charter a motor yacht and set out on an amazing journey, chasing spring up the west coast of the British Isles

programme.title: Two Men in a Boat Chasing Spring
programme.desc: Jeremy Norman and his partner Derek Frost charter a motor yacht and set out on an amazing journey, chasing spring up the west coast of the British Isles

programme.title: Mudlarking the Thames
programme.desc: Nicola White unearths the river's historical treasures

programme.title: The Great Way
programme.desc: Alba and Raul start their journey around the world greatest walking trails, a journey that will take them from Japan to Peru, passing through the United States

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton tours Outer Orkney, beginning at North Ronaldsay, which may be the most northerly of the Orkneys but turns out to be surprisingly easy to get to. Paul then hops across to Papa Stronsay, which is now populated by an order of monks who have chosen to make this isolated island their home, and ends on the island of Stroma in the Pentland Firth, a previously inhabited island that was abandoned in the 1950s. One of the last people to live there joins Paul to recall when it was still a thriving community

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton visits the islands of Coll and Tiree, which though just a few miles apart could not be more different. On Coll, he meets Nicolas Maclean Bristol, owner of Breachacha Castle, who can trace his ancestors on the island back to the 14th century. Tiree is one of the stormiest places in Europe, but is also one of the best places in Britain to surf and practise the relatively new sport of sand yachting, the racing of go-carts with a sail along the beach

programme.title: Coral Ghosts
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the work of Dr Tom Goreau, a marine biologist who inherited the family legacy of protecting the world's coral reefs when they have never faced greater threats

programme.title: The Foreman Went to France (1941)
programme.desc: A factory foreman sent into occupied territory to recover vital machinery from under the Nazis' noses. Fact-based Second World War comedy drama, starring Tommy Trinder, Gordon Jackson, Robert Morley and Clifford Evans

programme.title: On the Fiddle (1961)
programme.desc: A Second World War black marketeer is arrested, but a judge forces him to join the army rather than sending him to prison. He soon finds a willing accomplice in an easy-going fellow recruit, and together they concoct a variety of underhanded schemes to avoid being sent to the front line. Comedy based on RF Delderfield's novel, starring Alfred Lynch and Sean Connery

programme.title: Up in the World (1956)
programme.desc: A bumbling window cleaner is elated to land a job at an aristocrat's country house. However, the spoilt young heir to the estate likes to play pranks on him - and lands the hapless servant in very hot water after the pair make a trip to a nightclub together and walk straight into a kidnap plot. Comedy, starring Norman Wisdom, Michael Caridia, Maureen Swanson and Jerry Desmonde

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours for locals and tourists, exploring Elephant & Castle and Croydon. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Tabernacle Choir: Music and Words
programme.desc: Music and inspiration for everyday living from one of the world's most acclaimed choirs featuring regular guest artists

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: Part two of two. Koenig battles to halt the infiltration of Moonbase Alpha by dastardly alien beings. Sci-fi adventure, starring Martin Landau

programme.title: The Avengers
programme.desc: Electronics executives and industrialists are murdered by a super-strong, seemingly indestructible assailant able to smash through doors and solid walls. The only clue lies in the fact that every victim carried an identical fountain pen. Guest starring Burt Kwouk and Michael Gough

programme.title: Mr Pip (2012)
programme.desc: A teenage girl in war-torn Papua New Guinea finds comfort in the story of Charles Dickens' Great Expectations taught to her by her English teacher. However, her actions have unforeseen consequences when an army sent to destroy the rebels becomes convinced the mysterious Pip is their leader. Drama, starring Hugh Laurie and Xzannjah Matsi

programme.title: Buster (1988)
programme.desc: Fact-based crime drama about the life of Buster Edwards, a member of the gang responsible for the Great Train Robbery. Going on the run after the notorious heist, he flees to Mexico with his family. However, his homesick wife struggles to adapt to her new life, leaving the outlaw with a difficult choice. Starring Phil Collins, Julie Walters, Sheila Hancock, Larry Lamb and Ralph Brown

programme.title: Eden Lake (2008)
programme.desc: A couple on a romantic break find their peace shattered by a gang of youths who steal their belongings and vandalise their car. However, when they confront the youngsters they are subjected to a horrific attack, resulting in a deadly game of cat and mouse through the woodland. Horror, starring Kelly Reilly and Michael Fassbender

programme.title: News Rewind
programme.desc: A digest of news and events from across London from the past few days.

programme.title: Talking Points
programme.desc: 'Current affairs affecting Londoners today and a look at the latest shows and films in the capital.

programme.title: Pocket Dragon Adventures
programme.desc: A group of very small dragons live with a kindly old wizard, they're not big enough to fly but that doesn't stop them having many adventures

programme.title: Legend of the Dragon
programme.desc: The guardian of the temple has passed on and a new Golden Dragon must be Chosen from a brother and sister - Twins born in the Year of the Dragon. Only one will be chosen. Their sibling bond tested

programme.title: Roswell Conspiracies
programme.desc: The story of allied intelligence agents who've discovered aliens on Earth who are bent on taking over the world. In response, the agents form a top-secret multinational agency, The Global Alliance

programme.title: Extreme Dinosaurs
programme.desc: 65 Million years ago, Dinosaurs disappeared. Now they're Back! T-Bone, Spike, Bullzeye, and Stegz. Four prehistoric dinosaurs, evolved into intelligent beings reawaken in a bizarre new world

programme.title: The Theo the Mouse Show
programme.desc: Join mischievous mouse Theo and his best friend Wendy in their show full of comedy, magic and song

programme.title: Zot the Dog
programme.desc: The tales of Zot, a good-hearted, fun-loving but rather bouncy dog and his best pal, Clive

programme.title: Underwater World for Kids
programme.desc: An underwater adventure that takes in the many natural wonders and magical sea creatures above and below our oceans

programme.title: Dickensian
programme.desc: After Arthur almost gives the game away, Compeyson tries to win over Amelia in the hope of exerting influence on her business decisions. After visiting her father in the debtors' prison, Honoria reluctantly agrees to meet with Sir Leicester to discuss their courtship. Meanwhile, Inspector Bucket discovers that Jacob Marley owned a warehouse by the docks, the Bumbles hear some exciting work news, and Silas Wegg notices that Mrs Gamp has been helping herself to his gin

programme.title: The World's Most Incredible Hotels
programme.desc: The most extraordinary, iconic, and luxurious hotels ever built, taking in 26 destinations across 18 countries

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: Gordon's burgeoning idealism leads him to host a concert recital at the centre, featuring Russian pianist Vladimir Petrov. Comedy, starring Chris Barrie

programme.title: Big City Life
programme.desc: Documentary following a group of West Ham FC fans who have formed friendships by wearing colourful shirts when they support their team in the stands

programme.title: Monkey
programme.desc: The pilgrims come face to face with a deadly swarm of locusts led by the Demon Queen Grasshopper, which Monkey needs to stop before everyone is turned into pigs

programme.title: The Bells Go Down (1943)
programme.desc: A Londoner signs up to join an auxiliary fire service in the East End during the Second World War. He and his fellow volunteers encounter resentment from the regular fire brigade, but gradually, the professionals come to realise they cannot keep the city safe without the amateurs' help. Ealing comedy drama, starring Tommy Trinder, James Mason, Mervyn Johns and William Hartnell

programme.title: Lost Lagoon (1957)
programme.desc: A man lost at sea in a tropical storm ends up stuck on a desert island with a strange woman, and decides to let the rest of the world think he is dead so they can start a new life together. However, his plans are jeopardised when an insurance investigator comes looking for him. Drama, starring Jeffrey Lynn and Leila Barry

programme.title: Blackonomics
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the UK's Afro-Caribbean community's relationship with money when it comes to education, investing and building general wealth

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: Part two of two. Koenig battles to halt the infiltration of Moonbase Alpha by dastardly alien beings. Sci-fi adventure, starring Martin Landau

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London.

programme.title: Dispatches
programme.desc: Homelessness is on the rise in the UK, but nobody knows how many pregnant women face the possibility of having their baby without a home to go back to. This programme explores the issue of expectant mothers who find themselves with no place to call home, and conducts a survey of midwives in collaboration with the Royal College of Midwives to try to get a sense of the scale of the problem. Ninety-five per cent of the midwives asked strongly felt that homelessness puts the health of the women and their unborn babies at risk. The report follows three women - two of whom are heavily pregnant - experiencing evictions, overcrowding and the reality of living in temporary accommodation for years on end

programme.title: Dispatches
programme.desc: As Prime Minister Theresa May declares that austerity is over, the programme reveals the growing number of parents now using baby banks to provide their young children with nappies, clothes, toys and cots, with the vast majority having been set up since the austerity programme began. For the first time, Dispatches has surveyed these baby banks, to get a sense of who they're serving and the services they're providing and meeting working parents who can't afford the most basic essentials and have to rely on baby banks to provide for their children

programme.title: The Fall and Rise of Reginald Perrin
programme.desc: Reggie attends his own memorial service, and is disturbed to see how close his grieving widow has become to Henry Possett. Comedy, starring Leonard Rossiter and Pauline Yates

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours for locals and tourists, exploring Elephant & Castle and Croydon. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: The Alan Clark Diaries
programme.desc: As the pressures of a globe-trotting life as Minister of Trade begin to take their toll on Alan, matters at home are complicated when Heseltine's star begins to rise despite the best efforts of Margaret Thatcher. Returning to England, Alan feels out of favour and meekly accepts a low ministerial position

programme.title: London Districts

programme.title: Quest Boxing League

programme.title: Way Upstream (1987)
programme.desc: Two business partners and their wives take a trip in a cabin cruiser up a river. The festering resentments among the group are stirred further by a handsome stranger, who is soon taking over as captain of the vessel. Comedy based on Alan Aykbourn's stage play, starring Nick Dunning, Joanne Pearce, Barrie Rutter and Marion Bailey

programme.title: Mad Dogs (2002)
programme.desc: A mysterious disease sweeps the country, causing dogs to mysteriously die. In London, a recovering schizophrenic starts hearing voices in his head again, telling him he has 30 hours to save the world from itself before God destroys it. Comedy, starring Iain Fraser, Indira Varma, Jonathan Pryce and Saeed Jaffrey

programme.title: Dickensian
programme.desc: After Arthur almost gives the game away, Compeyson tries to win over Amelia in the hope of exerting influence on her business decisions. After visiting her father in the debtors' prison, Honoria reluctantly agrees to meet with Sir Leicester to discuss their courtship. Meanwhile, Inspector Bucket discovers that Jacob Marley owned a warehouse by the docks, the Bumbles hear some exciting work news, and Silas Wegg notices that Mrs Gamp has been helping herself to his gin

programme.title: Pocket Dragon Adventures
programme.desc: A group of very small dragons live with a kindly old wizard, they're not big enough to fly but that doesn't stop them having many adventures

programme.desc: 65 Million years ago, Dinosaurs disappeared. Now they're Back! T-Bone, Spike, Bullzeye, and Stegz. Four prehistoric dinosaurs, evolved into intelligent beings reawaken in a bizarre new world

programme.title: Roswell Conspiracies

programme.title: Dickensian
programme.desc: Compeyson comes closer to getting his hands on Amelia's inheritance when she invites him to the shareholders' meeting, confident she will need his assistance in running the business. Inspector Bucket makes a shocking discovery at Croucher's Warehouse, giving him enough evidence to arrest Fagin for the murder of Jacob Marley. Peter gives his savings to his mother after seeing her weep over Tim's poor health, and Mrs Gamp may have outstayed her welcome with Silas

programme.title: The Avengers
programme.desc: Electronics executives and industrialists are murdered by a super-strong, seemingly indestructible assailant able to smash through doors and solid walls. The only clue lies in the fact that every victim carried an identical fountain pen. Guest starring Burt Kwouk and Michael Gough

programme.title: Park Row (1952)
programme.desc: An ambitious reporter in 19th-century New York sets up his own newspaper, but his former boss will go to any lengths to rid herself of the competition. Drama, starring Gene Evans, Mary Welch and Bela Kovacs

programme.title: William and Mary
programme.desc: Terence's absence is proving difficult for Mary, who decides to visit him at his dad's in Brighton. However, her trip is cut short after Rick phones to tell her Molly's condition has worsened and she has to rush back to be with her in London. Meanwhile, William helps a young boy organise a memorial for his father, but his grandmother refuses to believe he is dead. Drama, starring Julie Graham, Cheryl Campbell and Martin Clunes

programme.title: Castle Builders

programme.title: Car Trouble (1986)
programme.desc: A sexually unsatisfied woman realises her husband's beloved new car means more to him than her. Comedy, starring Julie Walters, Ian Charleson and Stratford Johns

programme.desc: A young street hustler from London and a drugs mule from Europe form an unlikely bond after a violent confrontation. Thriller, starring Eddie Thompson and Isabella Nefar

Michael van Gerwen beat Gerwyn Price 18-14 in last year's final, as he won this competition for the third time. At this stage last year, van Gerwen beat Adrian Lewis 10-7. Previous winners include Scots Peter Wright and Gary Anderson, as well as Dimitri Van den Burgh and Phil Taylor.

programme.title: Live Women's Ashes
programme.desc: England v Australia. Live coverage of the third and final ODI in the multi-format series which takes place at The Cooper Associates County Ground, Taunton. The series started in June with a one-off Test at Trent Bridge, with Australia winning by 89 runs. England needed 268 to win and take four points into the white-ball formats, but Australian spinner Ash Gardner's incredible 8-66 led the visitors to victory
